description:
I've been going to Mehfil for years, and it's honestly one of my favorite Indian places in the world. Not like on any kinda of expert, but I've had Indian food on several continents, and I'm always drawn back here. 

Their lunch bowls are famous in SoMa, as is their Chicken Tikka Masala. But many of their other dishes are also great. 

It's a family operation, and I've seen the same guy running this place for over a decade. 

It's not the fanciest location, but the foods worth it.
author: Erik B.

description:
Mehfil is a popular lunch spot among the masses. In fact it's so popular we have an app built internally that scrapes the daily specials and returns the information back to us. I'm pretty impressed we have that kind of automation at our disposal. Also they print out daily menus for each day of the week as well. 

We dropped in during a busy Dreamforce week because Ippudo was quoting a 25 minute wait. That was outright crazy and we wanted to eat without waiting. After much deliberation, we settled on Mehfil and were seated right away when we arrived.

I was settled on the sizzling salmon hot platter. One thing I like about their specials is the inclusion of soup, salad, and naan. You get the most value out of it and I haven't been disappointed. I also got a mango lassi to go with my meal. Definitely get garlic naan with your meal. Back to the sizzling platter. The portion of fish was huge and we shared it family style. Also the quality of salmon was good and the fish was indeed fresh. 

There were some service issues.
1) They messed up and did not put in our second order of naan into the kitchen. 
2) We got an order of chicken tikka masala that we did not order (which we promptly sent back). 
3) We asked for a check and it took them ages to bring it over. 

This is A-OK with a 3.5 stars given it's close proximity, popularity among the masses, and their dedication to the menu.
author: Tim G.

description:
Food poisoning something fierce. No no no no. 

Bummer because it was our favorite. I only want to write to warn others and hopefully they will take this seriously.
author: Christina S.

description:
Seven dollars for a gigantic take-out box of rice and curry.  Vegetarian curries are six dollars.  What's not to love?   

They have several different curries available under their "Lunch Box" menu.  During my lunch break, I tried their chicken masala lunch box (without any naan) and boy it was filling!  I found the curry to be a good blend of creamy and hearty.  The chicken was a tad on the drier side, but I can't complain because it's still a great take out lunch special.  They also have a goat curry lunch box as well.
author: Hailey C.

description:
Brilliant takeaway place if you're craving for Indian food!

I've only been here for their "lunch boxes". You enter and walk down close to the kitchen. They pick up a box with rice in it. You can pick 1 or 2 fresh, hot gravies to go on top. They let you do 50-50 on two gravies.

I've had rajma and some paneer ones on different occasions, they're fantastic. You're in and out of the store in 5 mins tops.

Also, they're dirt cheap ($6 for the veggie box if you pay by cash, $7 with card). Would def recommend for takeout lunch!
author: Vignesh B.

description: I would say the place is decent. Had ordered lamb biryani and would say they offered a lot of quantity for the price. But I didn't get the kick of a typical indian biryani in that though would say its worth trying a dish there. Would be back  to try something else.
author: Sharad B.

description:
I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala ($7) to-go. If you order takeout, you will have to pay an additional $1 if you use a credit card. 

The meal had a really good value. My only complaint is that the chicken was a little dry. I was given a lot of chicken pieces though and a ton of sauce. The sauce was a little spicy. 

I was very full after eating this meal. I will probably come back in the future and try the vegetarian dishes. It's interesting how the takeout menu changes everyday.
author: Kristina M.

description: Good option for delivery when we are craving some indian food. The bengan bharta in particular is tasty!
author: Rachana S.

description: I only pick up my Mealpal orders here. It's a fast and easy Indian place that you grab Chicken Tikka Masala in 30 seconds.
author: Yanzhong L.

description:
I just got my delivery from yelp. Mehfil has the best butter chicken. Every time I order it from other locations, I'm disappointed. I ordered butter chicken, samosa, garlic naan, some stuff naan, and chai. Everything was really good. I'm surprised my chai was still hot because I live pretty far from the restaurant. They wrapped everything very well to avoid spilling.

The driver was an older Indian man. He was really rushing. He gave me the food and immediately rushed off. He's working super hard to make sure other deliveries are on time. I had to scream to him to give him his tip. 

I love this place and I will continue being a loyal customer. :)
author: Karen L.

description:
We love this place. Not only is the food great, but the service is fantastic. We're so comfortable here and are always confident in getting anything on the menu knowing it will be delicious.

Don't be thrown off by the appearance--cracked seats, stained walls--the place is old and worn but definitely clean. The bathrooms too, though disappointingly they are gendered despite being single stall.
author: Megan L.

description:
Where do you go for great Indian food? Look for a restaurant that has Indians eating there... and this great little place doesn't disappoint...
The lamb in the Rogan Josh was super and the rice was perfect and not sticky.
Naan left me wanting to buy extra to take home.
Service was great, everything clean...
Gulab jamon sadly tasted like my local store made it but c'mon, it's gulab jamon... only perfect when your grandma from Mumbai makes it...
author: Andy B.

description:
Amber India and Curry Up Now are definitely my favorite Indian lunch options downtown.  But sometimes you don't feel like pigging out at a buffet nor having Indian fusion.  That's when a bowl of curry and rice hits the spot.  It's not earth shattering, but it gets the job done at a reasonable price.

Chicken Tikka Masala: Not bad for a $7 lunch in the FiDi/SoMa area.  They give you a ton of tikka masala sauce, so the rice almost feels like creamy risotto.  The sauce really is the best part since it's so yummy and comforting.  The chicken chunks feel a bit dry though.  I mean this is easily mitigated by the generous sauce portion, but you'll definitely notice it when you bite through a large tikka chunk.

Garlic Naan: Not particularly garlicky.  Decent naan though with some parts light and crispy and other parts thick and chewy.  Probably an excessive add-on if you're getting a rice & curry bowl.
author: Adam B.

description:
This is a busy Indian restaurant in SOMA. It's conveniently located for a lot office crowd. It's not a fancy place, pretty basic but can do the job. I used to have questions about their hygiene level last year when their health rating was not great at all. It vastly improved this year. However, I never had stomach issues after eating here so I kept coming. When dining in, they serve dal soup which is especially nice for chilly days. My colleague orders his favorite butter chicken/chicken tikka masala most times which is good. Their naan is soft, easy to tear/break apart. I have tried different dishes.....they have been decent. Off late, I get egg biryani which they are able to customize for me. That's very convenient and it means they can make something fresh quickly...A lot of people also queue up at the back for to-go pickups which can be quite convenient. 
A decent place for Indian food.
author: Tejashree M.

description:
Great Indian food at a low price.

This may not be the best Indian food you can find in San Francisco but it is one of the best and definitely the best bang for your buck.

The service is fast and the menu is pretty good. Definitely try the food. It's true authentic punjabi food.
author: Naman G.

description:
Their butter chicken and tikka masala is BOMB.COM
Service is friendly and quick ! If you preorder over the phone, you can just get in and pick up your food! 
Their new location is HUGE, ample seating!
author: Kay H.

description:
I went this place last day with my friend and we order samosas and tea ..
Tall skinny guy brought samosas which is really good and tea he brought in dirty cup with, was cold ... it seems like we ordered hot tea but they serve as cold and service is not good at all ...once you order you have to wait for foreverWill never go back
author: Manu P.

description: Food was delicious and service was great. I really enjoyed the meat combination, the dessert was tasty too. I would come back and try the curry next time
author: S L.

description:
I think I was expecting more flavor from a Northern Indian food establishment.  I also am sad after eating it and now seeing the food safety score warning. 
On the other hand, it wasn't terrible.   The butter chicken was very "butter", and  I felt the chicken sagwala could have been less creamy.
author: Kelly C.

description: This place has steadily slid downhill. I eat there every few months and have finally had my last meal there. Less and less meat in their dishes, flavors slowly but surely disappearing, and whiter and whiter lettuce in their salads.  Search for better options...
author: SF Y.

description: Got the Chicken Tikka Masala ($7) with the Garlic Naan for a total of $9.50. Decent lunch, I like the sauce but as seen in other reviews the chicken was dry and the naan just tasted like dough, nothing too special.  The atmosphere seems nice and it's very, very quick to get your order as they have everything prepared already. For a 5 minute quick grab to go, this is good fast-food, but not the finest of foods.
author: Leo W.

description: A great lunch time place for a simple meal, and less than $10! I usually get the Chicken Tikka Masala, along with Garlic Naan, but I'm willing to experiment with some other options one of these days. The line moves very quickly. Perfect for people who are limited on time. I get 10% off my bill because of Yelp Cash Back, so I will keep on coming back for more!
author: Bryan M.

description: We discovered this place strolling on the 2nd. Although we reached almost at the closing time (9 30), the food they served was fresh. We had shahi paneer (comes with rice), garlic naan and aloo kulcha. All the items were very good. The restaurant was very spacious too, and having such a big restaurant just by the market was wonderful. Would definitely recommend and visit again.
author: Salman Khan P.

description:
Over all it's a nice place for lunch. There a seating section and a walk in grub a lunch to go section - both mix and you can be seated on a place where you see folks coming in and out every two minutes. Kind of wish they had the two separate, although to be fair they have a separate section to pay for the to go lunches. 
Also seating section is very cramped- if someone wants to squeeze by your table to get to their don't be surprise if they move your plates and dishes. This especially happens with the table for two. 
Service isn't terrible but it's not great either. We got to order our lunch pretty fast but then we're looking for the waiter when we wanted to leave. 

Food wise the place is great!

Try out the chicken tikka masala and the lamb vindaloo! They are a must!
author: Michael L.

description: Great price and delicious food. Their service reminds me of India. Quick and efficient, without small talk. I've seen a lot of people that consider this rude and leave a bad review. Just keep in mind it's not rude, it's just them trying to give you great service in a different way.
author: Alexandra H.

description:
Fast food doesn't need to be burgers and fries.

In the back of Mehfil Indian Cuisine is a busy kitchen and order station, rolled together.  Past the packed tables filled with hungry customers lies a place where you can order off a inexpensive to-go menu, that will get you in and out of the establishment in under 15 minutes.  In a handy bag loaded with rice, meats, and curries, you'll be able to indulge in a traditional Indian meal packed with tons of flavors and guaranteed to leave you full and satisfied.

The employees at Mehfil are fast and efficient, placing orders and getting your food ready in lightning speed.  You just line up, pick one of their under $10 combo meals, pay, and you'll be in curry goodness in no time.  With such a cheap cost of food, I recommend visiting Mehfil's frequently and sampling their entire lunch menu.

You can mix up your traditional lunch on the go with some tasty curries at Mehfil.
author: Nadav P.

description:
Pretty good food. The pricing is fair as well when compared with other nearby Indian restaurants. The taste is great and the serving size is pretty moderate as well. 

My only wish is that it would have been nice to have a better bathroom to wash your hands before you dine in. Their men's bathroom is quite small and claustrophobic.

Please revamp your bathroom. It's not a good look.
author: Manpreet S.

description:
Most of my jobs based in SF have always been in this area so I'm very familiar with Mehfil and have been going here for my Indian food cravings.

You can eat-in for lunch, but something that my coworkers and I like to do is head towards the back, like you're going to the bar, but it's more of a cafeteria-like situation where they have a specific menu. 

My standby is chicken tikka masala, but they also have really good meatballs!
author: Aivy C.

description: My favorite to-go lunch place in ask if FiDi where I can get a quick lunch for less than $10 total, I visit every time I visit SF on weekday lunches. I like that the menu rotates often. Rice is quite soggy; curry is delicious filled with many spices. Order Chai tea for $1.50. Please have cash ready, they charge $1 extra for credit cards. Service is very fast even in peak Lunch rush hour. I am in and out in under 3 minutes to get my curry lunch to go.
author: Susan T.

description:
I go to mehfil once a week and order the same thing. They have daily "to go" lunch specials for $7.  I order half veggies half chicken tikka Marsala.  It comes with rice.

You can't beat the price and the food is tasty and mildly spiced.

I keep going back!!
author: David L.

description:
They get three stars because the food is tasty. I had the Saag Paneer, Rice, and Meethi Naan and Chai for lunch. That is the positive. Unfortunately, a few negatives, and I doubt I'll be back: 
The service was confused, confusing, and just not great. A lot of waiting for things, including the menu, and butter I asked for. 
I also am always disappointed with Indian restaurants that don't offer a sugar-free chai tea, and/or no chai tea refill. 
I wish I could be more positive, everyone seems sweet, and like they were trying, kind of - but I just am not blown away enough by the food to tolerate the lack of service. The Saag Paneer was good, but the Meethi Naan was totally dry, and basically like dry white bread with a dusting of fenugreek powder. It's true , this is how the menu described it, but i was expecting something more buttery/authentic. 
One plus: Their Wifi works great, and they gave me the password without too much hassle. So that was good. :)
author: Marianna S.

description: Haven't even tasted the food yet, but ordered 51$ worth of entrees and nobody thought to tell me that they do not include rice. Now my food is here and I have to make rice before I can eat it. All they said when I called was, "We never send rice." Inconsiderate service.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Such a disappointing delivery order last Friday, May 13th. Our office ordered a bunch of lunch boxes for delivery along with naan, etc.

Unfortunately, they forgot one person's order and messed mine up completely. I ordered a lunch box, NO RICE. Mine arrived with... guess what?! Rice! I couldn't eat it as I don't like white rice. I also placed an order for Samosas, but those never arrived. The only thing that did was my garlic naan I wanted. But what am I going to eat with the garlic naan?! I didn't get any curry! Basically, I didn't get a lunch at all which was disappointing as I was starving!

Hopefully, my company wasn't charged by Mehfil for the two items they forgot and they refunded the messed up box as that wasn't what we ordered. I write this with some frustration as I really wanted Indian food that day. Mehfil was a complete FAIL!
author: Elena N.

description:
A review for their lunch service. Extremely fast, tasty, and inexpensive vegetarian and meat options. Vegetarian dishes over rice are generally $6 and meat is $7. They are friendly and accommodating and have a clean functional restaurant space.

Today I ordered the lunch combo and an extra side of pakora. Even without paying for wait service, they offered me water. Highly recommended lunch option downtown!
author: Gabe S.

description: We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Chicken, Raita, Egg Biriyani and some naan.  Everything was so delicious!  If you order from here, you won't be disappointed!  Definitely worth trying!
author: Jerilyn C.

description: I got the $7 tikka masala plus garlic naan. It's unremarkable, a little watery, kinda just...meh. It's enough to make you full, though. No major complaints.
author: Josh L.

description: The food is solid but the business is poorly run. Service is often terrible and I've gotten at least three incorrect orders when ordering online.
author: Ben M.

description:
This is a great place to get your Indian food fix. It's not a fancy place but they have got some great specialties. 

We ordered:
- chicken tikka (tender and moist!)
- karahi chicken (wasn't a fan)
- channa paneer (not a combination I've seen before but Mehfil did it well!)
- vegetarian malai koftas (this was the BEST dish, great sauce and very tender koftas)

Service was good, too. I'm definitely going back
author: Japna S.

description: I've never been to the physical restaurant, so I can't speak for the ambience or service, but I've ordered delivery several times and it's solid, reasonably priced Indian food. My go-to dishes are some combination of paneer makhani, tandoori prawns, samosas, and naan. Delivery has always been on-time and included the correct items.
author: Liron N.

description: I ordered the daal makhani for lunch and it was pretty good! Everything was quick and to the point - I was in and out within minutes (perfect if your in a crunch for time). Lots of great vegetarian options and, from the smell of it, everything is packed with flavor. The daal makhani had some heat to it, but otherwise, a very simple, tasty, and filling meal. The rice was nice and soft and made on the spot. My meal was a bit on the heavy side though, so I split it into two and saved the other half for dinner. Not a bad stop for lunch, and for the price, portion, and speed, it can't be beat.
author: Rebecca L.

description: I go here at least once a week for their lunch special. I usually get half meat and half veggies with rice for $7. The naan is $1 and the papadum is $2, and both are delicious. Nice place, great service; plan to have a formal dinner there soon.
author: Joseph T.

description: Mehfil's is amazing! It is my favorite Indian restaurant in the bay area. I make it a point to stay within walking distance to this restaurant and visit it multiple times when I'm in town.  My favorite is the tandoori chicken masala.
author: Michelle C.

description: Unbearable value in the city. $7 for a lunch that will fill you up. Delicious. Not super healthy, but fairly high quality. Can't beat it if you want a quick Indian lunch. Total in-out time is less than 5 min for takeout.
author: Matt H.

description: Disgusting food. Shame to call it Indian. Super oily pakoras. Tasteless chicken. Bad presentation. Beer had a weird taste. You rather sleep hungry that. Go to this place.
author: Vishal B.

description:
Awesome $5 lunch special! 

I love that the menu changes and I don't have to think about it. I get half-and-half of whatever the day's offerings are. Fast, easy and delicious.
author: Kim C.

description: Awesome foos. Authentic indian good and their spicy is actually spicy. Giving them 5 star as its worth it.
author: Ginny B.

description:
This food is way below average.  The beef vindaloo tastes like it was thrown together will little care or attention to quality.   For $13.95 You can expect much more from restaurants in SF.  

One saving grace is that it is not crowded after work and that is EXTREMELY hard to find in this neighborhood.  They also have $4.50 beers so it's not all bad.  

The service is also lovely.  Very friendly staff makes it pleasant to hang out at least.  

Too bad the food isn't better.
author: William D.

description: This little secret spot is a great go to place for quick, inexpensive and good Indian food. Walk to the back of the restaurant and order to go food there. They have five different bowls. When you go to the register ask for some Naan, even have garlic Naan. It's so funny because the pull the warm Naan out of a cooler. This was a really good warm $8 lunch.
author: Ken A.

description:
Plenty of "Mehfils haters" at the office believe that this place is inferior to the nearby North India establishment. To that I say "how many times did you get chicken bones if your chicken tikka from mehfils? None!". This is a great place to grab cheap take-out Indian food during lunch EVEN IF OTHERS FROM THE OFFICE DISAGREE. 

Don't forget to grab garlic naan!
author: Greg B.

description:
One of the best lunch deals in FiDi hands down.
I've only had their lunch takeout so this review is only for takeout.
$5-6/ veg or meat combo with rice - naan is $1-2 extra? Can't beat that.
Note: the lunch takeout deal is cash only or I think you can use your cc for an extra $1 charge - something like that.

They give you a huge serving of food and there's a rotating menu daily of curries and veggies. Chicken tikka malasa is always on the menu - the flavors are good though the chicken cubes were kinda dry the times I've had. 

I usually go with a combo of 2 veggies. I like that they serve up non-mainstream choices as well - one of the best dishes I had was curried radish and peas? I haven't seen this dish again but it was excellent.
author: Brenda L.

description: I'm writing in Regards the the Fillmore location. Which yelp says is closed but it's actually open. Worst delivery I've ever had. The delivery man called and yelled at me for not answering my phone then told me to come get my food because he wasn't brining it up to me. When I questioned what he was talking about and repeated my apartment number the man came up and threw my food at me. So much for treating myself to Indian take out at $30 for two items not including rice. The shame in this situation is the food is good. I will not order from this restaurant again.
author: Michele G.

description:
This place is pretty hit or miss. I came here with a group and the waiter spilled a hot sizzling plate all over one of my friends... and he didn't even apologize. The chicken was terribly undercooked (basically RAW!) so we ended up not eating it anyway. 

The first time I had their butter chicken it was amazing. I came again a week later, ordered the same thing, and it was clumped up and gross. 

Their lunch price is competitive... but there's so many other (and better) lunch places I think their inconsistency and low quality service don't make up for it.
author: Kelly T.

description:
Mehfil is great if you're looking to grab a quick lunch. They have a lunch box menu which comes with white rice and a choice of curry. They have 5 curries to choose from. The chicken tikka masala or the lamb curry are both decent options. You can also get a combination of two curries.

The food isn't bad but nothing thats really ever been exciting. It would nice if both the rice and curry were kept warm. Although for $6 it's a steal. You can add on a naan for $2 at the cashier. 

The lines move really quick so you can be in and out within 5 minutes. Wish they accepted credit cards (cash only).
author: Zoher Z.

description: Quick and delicious Indian food conveniently located in the Financial District. I made a reservation ahead with Allset, our table and food was promptly set upon our arrival. Note that the pricing on Allset is higher than the take out option at Mehfil.
author: Lexy C.

description: Service could have been a little better, but the food was really good. Great authentic Indian food!
author: Nicole N.

description:
*THIS POST HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THE FOOD BUT THE DRIVER WHO DID DROP OFF OUR DELIVERY* Haven't even gotten to it yet since I'm still in shock about what happened. 

You would think that getting food delivered earlier than expected would be great! But to my surprise, I had a very angry driver drop off our food banging on the closest window to my front gate. I have a doorbell and it works perfectly fine. I also have a phone number that is left with you in case you need to reach me. 

First and only thing he asked me about was a TIP since I paid through eat24 and only paid for my meal. I literally did not know who was banging at my window at 9PM at night but I didn't bring cash so I went back upstairs to get some money and didn't have any singles so I had a good amount of coins in my hand. 

I told him "this is the only change I have. There's some coins in there" I know it seemed kinda shady that I had coins in my hand but he was not happy, put his hand in my face and walked away from me talking the most shit about me and my coins.

Thanks for your shitty service. You definitely did not deserve the 20% tip that was only partly in quarters.
author: Caroline R.

description: Wow this restaurant is perfect for lunch and dinner. I used to go there for lunch box everyday. But now I moved to LA. I missed this place. My mom and her friends visited Mehfil on Thursday evening for dinner on my recommendation. And Mehfil proved it 100%. I never write any review before but can't stop my self to write today. They said food was super delicious and service was excellent. They didn't know about much of Indian spices but girl came to table to explain when they were asking to turban guy about all. She explained and gave some great guidance about North Indian food.    Overall i just wanna say it's worth to recommend someone for Mehfil great food. I will visit to you guys soon. Loved it.
author: Ashley M.

description:
5-stars for their lunch deal - we dined in

$12.99 for (I can't remember the name) - a chicken dish cooked in a clay pot with onions and bell peppers with some fresh lemon that I squeezed on top (it was fantastic I wish I could remember) (5/5)

But I also tried my friends chicken tikka masala and it was good (5/5)

The salad and the soup were okay, the rice was pretty good (standard).

Service was pretty good too.

MAIN POINT:
Basically, the lunch special is fantastic - lots of options for a great price and lots of food (it also helps that the food is pretty good)
author: Alexander W.

description:
Highly recommend for lunch box service is very fast and with smiling face. High quality, authentic, delicious Indian food in downtown. 

The portions are plenty for one person. 

I always get the vegetarian curry. I recommend the chicken tikka masala and saag paneer. Saag paneer is amazing 

The atmosphere is really good . It's also very spacious so you get your own space. The waiters and waitresses are extremely polite and attentive to your needs so your glass is never half empty.
author: Lakhwinder G.

description:
A quick and easy spot to grab lunch. I find myself coming here a lot just because the food is super quick (in and out within 2-3 mins) and it's tasty. I always go for their lunchbox and choose half/half of something. I have gone maybe 10 times now and I have yet to see a repeat in curries so they have a huuge variety. Usually 2-3 of the curries are vegetarian which, in my opinion, taste the best but I don't go for the ones with mushroom or eggplant. Bottom line, Mehfil is just a good place to go if you are in a hurry or have no idea what you want to eat :)

***CASH ONLY!!!
author: Tiffany E.

description: This is for take out lunch... very fast service..good food.. cheap as well...love their saag paneer..
author: Srinivas A.

description:
When it's this wet and miserable out, I'm glad that there is a convenient place to get some curry takeout around the corner from work. And it's a steal too.

The $5 and up lunchbox keeps office workers coming during the week. You can dine-in (lunchbox n/a for dine-in) but it seems most folks head right to the back and get in line for the lunchbox. Chicken tikka masala is a daily staple but I do love the fact that they rotate the rest of the menu every day for variety. Of those daily specials I like the Soia Murg - cubed chicken cooked in a dill herb curry sauce, and the self explanatory chicken asparagus curry. I often ask for more curry gravy to soak up the basmati rice. 

It does feel like they've practiced some restraint on the level of heat and spice but for a quick and cheap curry lunch, especially on a rainy day, I'm glad I can run over to Mehfil between meetings.
author: Jon L.

description:
Mehfil is a very convenient to-go lunch spot in the FiDi area. I like their bento boxes which are usually $5-6, depending on their specials of the day. My favorites are the VEGETABLE BIRYANI and GARLIC CHICKEN in tomato sauce.  I like how customers have the option mix/match the veggie and meat dishes for the bento boxes. You may also get a side of mint chutney and tamarind sauce for no extra charge. The portions are pretty decent for the price.

I personally prefer North India's lunch bento boxes, but I will add Mehfil to my lunch rotation as a cheaper option.

They also offer a lunch buffet and I'll come back sometime soon to try eating inside the restaurant.
author: Bonnie Z.

description: Hadn't read reviews before going there and was unaware of the safety rating. I am here for 2 days with my family and was casually roaming  around Market St when saw this restaurant and went for dinner. Except Dal Makhani every thing was awful. Chicken was undercooked with burnt capsicum. The parantha and roti were so thick that it tasted like rubber. Very bad experience. The service was quick and good.
author: Swapnil G.

description:
If you're ready to stand in lines out the door and waste half your lunch hour waiting around for a salad, there are plenty of other options during the noontime weekday hour surrounding the Financial District. If you're over the rush and just want to be in & out in literally a minute without much hassle or fanfare, do the Mehfil lunch option (take-out only). 

The restaurant is still crowded with people, but if you head to the back they have the trays of that days selected menu. They literally just pour into a to-go container, you head up to the counter, and you're out in a minute. Plus it's only $5 if you pay cash. Employees are definitely indifferent to the customers, clearly focused on getting you through the line as fast as possible. Eh, I want to be out of there quick anyways ... 

Today I had the chicken cranberry. Chicken was tender and it had some flavor to it, nothing out of this world but still enjoyable for the amount I spent on it. There was way too much rice compared to the actual chicken/cranberry. Even eating rice with every bite and some in between I was left with at least half a container of rice when I finished the main part of the meal, which was slightly disappointing. Flavor, good. Portions could use some evening out. 

It's not a place you would go if you had time to go anywhere else, but if you're in a rush for the price/location/speed it'll do the trick.
author: Kailyn T.

description:
Food was very good.
Mehfil naan was great.

delivery took forever though. for a place that's .2 miles from my apartment, 1hr 25mins seems like a lot.
author: A P.

description: Chicken Tikka was delicious! Food came quickly and service was good. What more could you want?
author: Sammy M.

description:
This is only for the LUNCH BOX takeout food. 

First off in the Financial Area food can get very expensive! So to be able to find a cheap ($5-$6) and fast take out place is amazing. 

Im usually there at 11am and there is no one at all - in and out - easy peasy!

Everyday they have new items on their Lunch Box takeout menu. I have tried a couple of things - Saag Paneer, Chicken Asparagus, Meatballs, chicken and mushrooms - and sadly ALL of these dishes lack flavor. 

Other than the fast/cheap service its the Chicken Tikka Masala that gives it the 4 stars! It is so delicious SOOO much flavor and spice its amazing! 

lastly dont forget - Bring your cash or you get scolded :)
author: Nina M.

description:
I've had better Indian food, but for a quick lunch spot, this place is pretty solid. Good flavors overall, but the meat isn't consistently cooked well. Lunch takeout is super cheap - only $5-6!! - which is pretty much nothing compared to a lot of the lunch options around FiDi. Their takeout menu rotates daily

=========================

*** RECOMMEND ***

-CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA - 3.5/5
Yummy! The curry is delicious, but the chicken is a little inconsistent - sometimes super tender, sometimes a little dry and sometimes very dry.

-LAMB CURRY - 4/5
Pretty good, though the lamb is also inconsistent. Some pieces are tender and others are too dry and overcooked.

-MEHFIL-E-MIX / MIX VEGETABLES - 5/5
Veggies are well cooked and the sauce is very flavorful with a hint of heat

-SAAG PANEER - 4/5
Pretty good and flavorful. This would be so much better if there was good naan to dip with!

-SAMOSA - 4/5
Their samosas are pretty big. Nice and crispy on the outside without being super greasy, and full of potatoes, spices and a little heat on the inside. I wish there were more peas though to balance out all the potatoes.

=========================

*** PASS ***

-NAAN - 2/5
Not that good. I love naan, but their naan is doughy and undercooked. Too chewy for my liking. Honestly, the Costco naan tastes better

-GARLIC NAAN - 2.5/5
Plain naan garnished with some fresh garlic. Same as the plain naan - too doughy. The garlic at least gives it some more flavor, but I've had much, much better.

-PANEER PAKORA - 1/5
[Cottage cheese marinated in chickpea batter, spices, and herbs]
Not really a fan of the texture. It's basically like fried cottage cheese. 

-CHICKEN TIKKA- 2/5
Not that good. Chicken is too dry and lacked flavor. The chicken tikka masala is much much better

-CHICKEN LACHNA - 1.5/5
[Fried chicken strips]
Meh. Dry strips of fried chicken. Lacking flavor.

-RAITA - 1/5
[Yogurt mixed with cucumber, mint leaves]
Has a hint of heat in it, but way too sour
author: Jessie L.

description: I have worked in this area for almost 12 years. When I first started working in the area mehfil was located on the corner of 2nd and Harrison, which was great because it was literally across the street and a block up from my office, quick, delicious, inexpensive lunch. 5 years ago I changed jobs and moved near Market and 2nd, Mehfil did the right thing and moved closer to my new office. I assume this is because they loved me so much, but could have been that it's a larger space and more central for a lunch rush. Either way, I still eat here often, and still love their food. CTM w/ Naan is my go to, but from time to time I'll switch it up, I've yet to find anything here that disappoints.
author: Thomas W.

description: Their chef changed at some point this year... Saag paneer is way different - less flavor, less spinach, light it was bulked with corn starch. Lunch to go, is still a great value at $6-$7 but it's not as tasty as it used to be and they're less generous with the sauce.
author: Lily H.

description: Great food. Good value. Recommended for a quick Togo . The service is efficient and staff is courteous.
author: Akshay J.

description: Finally, this yelp inspection confirms, why I was not feeling right when I ate there after lunch. I had there chicken ticka masala and there Mango chicken Something.. (lunch special) now I know why they call it a "lunch special".  Avoid eating here, seriously spend the extra 5 at another place if you have too.
author: Ruthie V.

description: Bad Service and bad food. We went for a casual office lunch in a small group. I ordered sizzling chicken tikka. The waiter spilled hot sauce from the the sizzler on my lap and did not even apologize. He just gave me a new cloth napkin. My chicken was undercooked. So I returned it. I tried other dishes my co-workers had ordered. I did not like them either. Overall, bad food and bad experience. I am not going back there.
author: Sanjay A.

description: So I ended up ordering the $6 box meal. The food was okay. edible and okay. But the people working there were rude. So when I bought the box meal, the lady behind the cashier, she said I could sit somewhere at the extreme end of the restaurant just because I order a box meal. The second option she said was to sit outside the restaurant which I didn't want to as yesterday was quite a sunny day in SF! I ended up sitting inside on a 2 people seating. I was just about to eat and she STOPPED ME. She said I cannot sit there. Mind you the entire restaurant was EMPTY. And I was on my feet for straight 5-6 hours and I just wanted to sit. So I took the meal for to go. They were really really rude.
author: Aditi K.

description:
This place is very popular for dine-in and extremely popular for take-out. The take-out is quick, hot, flavorful and inexpensive. Everything I have had is great. I love the Chicken Tika and the Paneer dishes. For the take out you'll get a bed of white rice and your choice of 5 items on the top. (no brown rice available)
 If you want all of the veggie dishes, say "Veggie Combo" you'll get the 2 veggie dishes on the bed of rice, your container of lovely food will be $5. If you want a meat selection pick the number from the menu 1-5 (read the menu on the column in the back) and it will be rice + main dish for $6. You can mix and match, if you wish. The serving area is a steam table in back. The serving dishes (round bowls) lock tight. It is $5 veggie or $6 meat with cash. Charge/Debit is a bit more. The staff is friendly, the wait time is short, and in this high-priced area of downtown SF, you cannot get a better lunch. REALLY good, and especially if it is one of those windy foggy days. Enjoy!
author: Jacqueline S.

description: I had been here only once and I had very very bad experience, the place looks pretty decent and the food wasn't that expensive but the food made me very very sick and that was not fun! I have heard my friends complain about the cleanliness of this place despite of it I went there. I ordered saag paneer that comes with rice. The rice was stale and dry and the curry was very flavorless. Never going back here.
author: Shwetz M.

description:
Really liked it!

Pros:

- chicken was good and flavorful
- big portion
- offers brown rice substitute 
- service was quick

Cons:

- pricey... lunch was $13
- tables are a bit too close together
author: Greg S.

description: Came here for their lunch special and got exactly what I was about expecting. Got chicken tikimasala over rice and also bought some garlic naan bread with it. Came to about $10 bucks out the door which was an absolute steal. Not the best Indian food I've ever had, but it was very tasty. Not too over the top spicy and the naan was perfect with the tikimasala sauce. The staff was friendly and offered some suggestions on what to eat. The place looked clean overall and was very busy during the work lunch hours, but I was in and out in under ten minutes. Would definitely give this place another shot soon for some Indian food!
author: James R.

description: This review is only for the take-away lunch special. As an Indian, I can tell you that their curries are mostly watered down and sometimes lack proper seasoning.
author: Harsha R.

description:
This review is only for the to-go lunch boxes. Here's a breakdown of my 3-star rating:

5 stars for price - you can't beat a $6 lunch box for chicken tikka malasa 

3 stars for chicken:rice ratio - i got 3 pieces of chicken and enough rice to feed a village. it's a ton of food but could use more chicken and less rice. 

1 star for cleanliness - i found 2 eyelashes and a piece of hair in my box. super gross. 

Overall, you get what you pay for. apparently i paid for rice with a side of human hair.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Delicious traditional Indian food in DT SF! Great garlic bread. 

FOOD: My friend and I shared the korma lamb ($13) and Achaari Chicken ($11) over rice and garlic bread ($2.50). The korma lamb was delicious - I really liked the different aromatics in the curry sauce, and there were giant pieces of lamb meat, so it very satisfying to eat. We asked achaari chicken to be moderately spicy, which was a bit too spicy for me. The garlic bread was really good - very doughy. We also ordered mango juice ($2.50), which had almost a milkshake texture and tasted very good. 

PRICE: With tips & tax, we each paid $20, which is more expensive than what I would usually pay. But it was a very balanced meal and I really liked everything we ordered. 

SETTING: The restaurant is conveniently located in Union Square. There are 20-25 tables inside and lots of space to move around. We came here when the Warriors were playing and good thing they have TVs! (not that I really watch sports....)

SERVICE: We came on a Sunday night and we were sat down immediately. Our order came by very quickly also. The waiter was very nice and gave us very sincere recommendations. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: I liked it! Even though it's a little expensive, I really enjoyed everything I ordered and the restaurant setup/location.
author: Wendy F.

description: We actually went for a sit-down meal and it was excellent. There's a lot of variety on the menu and we enjoyed veggie and chicken dishes. However I'd have to say the take out lunches look to be the main feature and I'll have to come back to try.
author: Lisa K.

description:
I was working at san francisco downtown, and had many times a lunch at mehfil. I really like Saag Paneer, and strongly recommend this veggie. It's been a year but I couldn't find better saag anywhere else. Go for it.

Parking: Parking is a bit of a headache as the restaurant is located in downtown. It would be really difficult in weekends to find a parking spot. 

I have visited the place after a year or so in search of some authentic North Indian food and I am delighted to say the quality of Saag Paneer is still intact. I would highly recommend the restaurant's Saag Paneer.

Service: Service is pretty good.

Cost: Cheaper than most Indian restaurants at SF downtown

They give complimentary rice along with veggie.
author: Chints V.

description: It is a great place to go for lunch. It is reasonably priced, and very good. Dinner options are also great.
author: Wyatt S.

description:
Sigh. I was expecting a neutral experience. I ordered a biryani on a Thursday night. It has been ages I have experienced a lazy staff. They simply forget the customer they seated - again and again. How hard is it? Seat them - serve water and menu, take order, deliver order, do a courtesy call, clean up, produce bill, produce receipt, say goodbye. They missed me on most of these touch points. I could've walked out at any time, but I waited, waited, waited and then the waitress finally saw me having asked her 15 minutes ago for the bill and she went like 'OMG!' And asked another waited to bring the bill. Not even an apology. 

As I write this its been 10 more minutes and no one has come to pick up my card to complete the payment. 

Guess they dont really care? 

Also, the biryani had wet rice. Its was more of a chicken rice gumbo. The dry fruit was soggy. 

And cherry on top is the waitresses buttering with a bigger family on the next table.

I started with 2 stars. I am going to walk the bill to counter. Decreasing a star. I wish we could go to zero with stars too!
author: Zaki S.

description: The lunch combo was only $5 and you get to choose two items over rice. The portions were medium sized but it was good for lunch. The curries were very flavourful and I liked how they have multiple vegetarian options.
author: James S.

description:
I are here tonight as I was I close to the area and the fiancé wanted Indian food. We ordered the veggie korma and the aloo gobi (potatoes and cauliflower), we also got a mango lassi, and garlic nan and raita.

The mango lassi was delicious, it had a wonderful flavor without being overpowering. The aloo gobi and the veggie korma were both very good. The service was excellent and the portions are a nice size.

Mp's take: check this place out!!!
author: Maninderpal M.

description: Got chicken tikka masala. Really delicious! And kind server. I'll probably come back to show my friends this place
author: Katie Y.

description: I ordered from Mehfil on Uber Eats, specifically because it guaranteed delivery in under 30 minutes. After waiting for over an hour, I contacted Uber, to request help. A few minutes, later Mehfil called me to inform me that they could not process my order as requested (no onions). I asked them why it took an hour for them to contact me, and they simply said they would cancel my order.
author: Carlos K.

description:
I don't know why, but I've been on a curry splurge the last week or so.  Even though it's right across from where I work, I never really considered coming here for lunch.

Pretty simple concept if you're doing takeout.  Go all the way to the back of the restaurant and they have a takeout menu; veggie options are just $5 (cheaper than Subway!) and any takeout item with chicken or lamb is $6.  CASH ONLY!  You'll be in and out within 5 minutes pretty much.

The chicken tikki masala is probably my favorite, but the chicken is questionable.  I've gotten it twice now and the first time the chicken was too dry and overcooked, the second time it was cooked pretty well.  If you're looking to get some naan, it'll also set you back another $3.

Not a bad place if you want food to go!
author: Kevin C.

description:
I wish there were separate reviews for different concerns. *sigh*

Anyways for a $6 lunch, speedy lines, and great tasting food--this place deserves a 5 star rating. This has nothing to do with delivery or anything outside of my experience here. I went in ordered, got the food, paid the cashier, and I was in and out within 5 mins.

Oh, make sure you get the Mango Lassi. It goes well with your $6 meal. =D
author: Justin L.

description: This is low-priced for a reason. Unless you are on a strict budget, I would recommend avoiding this place
author: Michael L.

description: Great lunch spot in downtown I have  ever seen . This is an amazing place for lunch if you are craving some Indian food. I've had great experiences with their lunch box and dine in. First of all food is amazing if you want to get lunch box. It's just 6 for vegetarians and 6to 7 for non vegetarians. You can also get side of Naan as well. Staff is so friendly and cashier girl will always attend you with smiling face. Chicken tikka masala is delicious but don't forget to get goat curry. It's once in month but so good. I cannot miss it.                                                      Overall excellent service and food. I worked 10 mints away from this restaurant but this is becoming my daily lunch deal. Everything is so much organised you can get you lunch with in 2 minuets service is so fasy
author: Money85ful ..

description: Easily the best ratio of price / taste / portion size for takeout lunch I've seen in downtown SF!  You'll break the bank at $9.50 if you also order naan, but if you do, definitely get the garlic naan.  Their lunch menu changes frequently, too, and you can mix/match amongst the 5 options.  The only permanent option (#5) is chicken tikka masala, and I always order that as 1/2 of my order.  If you're a fan of consistency and deliciousness, do *not* miss out on lunch at Mehfil.
author: Josh B.

description:
This place is ridiculous. 

I've come here on and off for four to five years. I order over the phone and I always go and pick it up. I always ask them how long it will take and it's always 10-15 minutes. I know that's bs, because I always have to wait when I get there, but that's ok. At least I know what to expect, and so I'm nice, courteous, and understanding.

With all that said, last night is the last time I'm coming here. 

8:30pm - I call in my order and they tell me 10-15 minutes, per usual. I'm with my daughter and she's about to knock out in her car seat. 

8:40pm - I arrive at Mehfil. At this point, my daughter is asleep. I run inside and try to pay, but the guy is on the phone. He doesn't even acknowledge me. About 5 minutes later, he waves a lady down and she swipes my card and asks me to take a seat as the order is still being prepared. I told her I will be back. 

8:55pm - I run back in and take a seat. Still nothing. The lady acknowledges me, but I go back outside.

9:10pm - It's taken longer than I would like, so I wake my daughter up and take her inside with me to wait. We sit down together and my daughter is still half-asleep. I ask the lady when the food is ready and she asks me to repeat my order (even though she took my money and confirmed me order oh, about half an hour ago). She said she will check on the order. It's clear to me that the order was never started. I woke my daughter up for this? Since I've waited this long, I might as well wait some more, right?

9:20pm - The guy who initially ignored me comes by and asks me, "you placed your order already, right?" At that point, I had enough. I told him to "forget it -- I've already waited over half an hour for the order and it's still not ready. Forget it x 3." He didn't offer to refund the money or apologize or anything. I just walked out I was so angry at them.

Bottom line tl;dr version: They took my money; made me wait nearly an hour; did not give me my food; did not apologize; did not refund my money; so I took off and will never go back to this wretched place ever again.
author: Ken L.

description: Stopped by with a couple of coworkers for lunch recently. We ordered three curry dishes and some naan. Food was very good, on par with the places I've been in the TL. Service was friendly but our waitress was inexperienced and it took 30-35 minutes to get our food. Fortunately we weren't in a rush so it wasn't a big deal, but it could have been challenging if we were trying to get out in an hour or less.
author: John C.

description: I was going to get something basic and cheap BUT their sign outside captured my eyes. Ordered a Chicken Tikka Masala and man it does not disappoint! Soooo good! The person who was serving the portions was helpful as it was my first time. Order in the back, walk to the bar area to pay. They charge you a dollar if you use a card but whatever. Its worth it! The food is delicious! I will be back for more!
author: A o S.

description:
Food - 4/10
-Subpar Salad
-The Tandoori Shrimp was over-seasoned, to the point where I could not taste any difference between it and Tandoori Chicken. Bad
-Okay rice
-The Naan tasted great. Warm and Fresh!

Service - 6/10
-Nice waiter overall, but forgot to get naan for our table until the end of the meal
-No extra water left at our table, which with spicy food would be really nice. No waiter in sight, so I got up and got a pitcher of water for our table. A bit later on, the waiters were much better at bringing water to our table.
author: Brian F.

description:
I came to Mehfil so many times so i felt im obligated to write a review.

Came here mostly for the lunch specials. CASH and super quick if you want a hearty and filling meal. 

My favorite dish is saag paneer. Their chicken tikka masala was actually alright. 

I've also sit down and ate here once for a team lunch. Got lunch special tandoori shrimp and it was pretty good. Came with a small soup and salad (with very spicy dressing), those jumbo shrimps were heavily marinated and flavored. Came with a tomato-based dipping sauce which tastes like butter chicken sauce.
author: Ruxin H.

description: I think this restaurant needs diamonds rather then stars. DELICIOUS !! One of my favorite resturant in the SAN FRANCISCO will be "MEHFIL INDIAN CUISINE ".Because the food quality and quantity Is delicious .Especially my favorite dish is Chicken tikka masala and coming  to the staff is very attentive and friendly.They will make you feel very welcome.The inside is always perfectly clean and immaculate with lovely decor.if you live in San Francisco and haven't tried ....you must
author: Arjun Goud K.

description: Been here a few times for lunch, busy in general.  I enjoy their lamb dish very much, any lamb.  Good lunch!
author: CAScuba Y.

description: I like the food here, but don't expect any requests to actually be honored. Twice in a row I've ordered green chutney sauce, and both times they simply don't add it to the order. I will not order here again.
author: Florian R.

description: Awesome place to eat indian food. Food is very nice.  Alot of special love to visit here soon
author: Dipin K.

description:
Really flavorful Indian food.  The staff is friendly and the food is delicious.  Prices are reasonable.

The sauces and seasonings are very nice.  We went for dinner, ordered 2 dishes, 2 naans, and 2 drinks and it was plenty with leftovers.  The sweet lassi was very good.

I have not tried their discounted lunch menu yet but look forward to it.
author: Hui C.

description:
***Warning: Only based on Lunch Rush Menu***

Passing by this place to work a couple of times, I noticed that they have a $5-6 menu during lunch hours. I especially wanted to try them out after seeing one of my coworkers eating it. Forgetting lunch in my car one day, I decided to check them out.

Located like a block away from the Montgomery Bart Station, you can find this restaurant. Like I said, this review is only based on the Lunch Rush Menu. Instead of sitting down and ordering, if you ask for the Lunch choices, they'll send you to the back of the restaurant at a Cafeteria style counter.

There are like 5 or so different items to choose from. All times I've went, I've only had the Chicken Tikka Masala. They fill the bottom of the to-go plastic tupperware with rice and smother the top with a couple of pieces of chicken and the Tikka Masala sauce. This alone is only $6, and you can add Naan bread for an extra $1.50/$2.00 depending on your choice of plain or garlic perspectively.

***Note: There is a sur charge if you pay with card***

The chicken is cooked well and the sauce is sooooo good. It's got some spice, but it's not overwhelming. You get a good amount for the value. It's definitely good if you're in the area. Forewarning, this price is only during lunch, which I think is only until about 5:00pm (not too sure on the end time)
author: Robert O.

description:
I also have a love hate relationship with Mehfil.

I've eaten the $5 lunch special at least once a week for over two years. It is delicious, but recently they started shorting people on portion sizes. Most of my coworkers eat here weekly as well and we all agree - the short guy (who took over serving responsibilities from the tall guy) does not dish out enough. It's to the point where I have to buy two lunches.

The only other good $5 lunch that I'm aware of is at the Gold Club.
author: Charles K.

description:
I got m'fill at Mehfil! But really... they're good portions for the price. 

Go to the back and get in the line that is somewhat reminiscent of the soup Nazi episode of Seinfeld, and pay at the bar. Quick, cheap, and delicious.
author: August Y.

description:
I love Mehfil's lunch special, haven't gone for dinner. Tiki Masala is a safe choice and always on the menu with 4 other rotating options. Even with the raise in price from 5 to 6 dollars, it's still a great deal.

Walk in, go straight to the back. They have the lunch special posted on the columns.

The people in the back will hook you up if you ask. They'll do half and half of two orders, or if you like it spicy they have a red powder they'll add. Be careful though! They like to add a lot.

Enough food to keep you full by itself, but if you're really hungry get the Naan.
author: John O.

description: A colleague was visiting from Miami. We stood out late the night before so I was dreading lunch all morning (I couldn't even hold down water!). To my delight the Jasmine rice filled me up, tasted scrumptious, and neutralized my stomach for the rest of the day. Service was attentive and efficient. This spot has my vote!!!
author: Vanessa G.

description:
RAW CHICKEN. 

After reading the other reviews, my colleagues and I were enthusiastic about trying this place for their $6 lunch box. Everything seemed fine until I started eating the dish. I noticed that the texture of some of the chicken pieces seemed off - not nearly as firm as they should have been. I just assumed it may have been some fat. Then one of my colleagues made the same observation and after a careful examination, we noticed that the chicken was still raw. 

I returned to the restaurant with a couple pieces of the raw chicken and brought it to the attention of the staff. The lady with whom I spoke did not seem to grasp the severity of the situation and just looked at the other staff for guidance. She mentioned it to at least two other employees, yet no one took any action. In the end, she took the chicken and told me that since I had only brought a small portion, she couldn't offer any compensation. Although I wasn't seeking compensation, an establishment that is truly committed to customer service would have gladly offered another dish at no cost. At the very least, the gesture would have been appreciated. 

Although serving raw chicken is never acceptable, it was Mehfil's handling of the situation that was particularly troubling. Their anemic response to my negative dining experience ensured that my first time would be my last time.
author: Jason C.

description: I used UberEATS to order from this restaurant today. I ordered 2 chicken tikka masala. The description clearly states that it comes with rice. Once I got my order I didn't see the rice. I called the driver, he said no rice was given to him, I called restaurant and they say rice is extra. So I'm arguing with him bc I for damn sure know how to read and I didn't get my rice. I ordered extra rice at that. Shows on my receipt and still didn't get rice. I ended up hanging up on the guy and calling UberEATS. The lady was nice. She looked up the menu to make and seen the same thing. She calls restaurant and gets the same attitude that I received. UberEATS ended up giving me my money back and a homeless man got a decent meal for today. I'll never order from this place ever again. They do not honor their menu.
author: Charletta S.

description: They run a few specials a day and you go to the back and order from an assembly line style. My CTM box was about $9 with garlic naan. Good flavor and meal on the quick and cheap! Try to bring cash as they charge $1 for credit cards.
author: Alyssa J.

description: A bead of sweat runs down my forehead. I cannot help myself. Rich deep flavors I will never be able to reproduce or fully comprehend. Wheelchair accessible with on-grade entry and dining area and a wheelchair lift to the bar. The Amritsari naan was so simple yet the profound impact of combining sesame seeds, onion seeds, fennel seeds and poppy seeds on a perfect naan has left me floored and utterly devoted.
author: Daniel P.

description:
This place is great. I've been going here on and off for years now because my offices have been nearby. I usually get the takeout special, which has veg and non-veg options. The $5/$6 takeout is tasty, filling, and inexpensive. I love their beef meatballs takeout, and their veg options are very, very tasty, with a variety of vegetables in each dish, with a menu that rotates daily, especially for the veg options. 

Tip: For the takeout, you can have "half-and-half", like a meat and a veg, and they'll just charge you the higher of the two (usually $6 total). This is a great option to get a more balanced meal.

Tip: For the takeout. There are several "private public spaces" including one just across the street and down a little where you can eat. Google private public spaces SF and you can see a list. There is also an app that shows them on a map.
author: Jimmy H.

description:
The rotation of restaurant operations at the severely jinxed address of 28 2nd Street has been mind-boggling. Let's see, it was once the Lunch Menu and then it was an Italian place called Castafiore. And oh yes, then there was the two-part South Asian period where it became Bindi, a place I liked and even received an ROTD for my review of it, and for no reason I could think of, it changed into Okra while serving basically the same food. Then for less than a nano-second, it became Cafe Med, where they had a pretty good Mediterranean buffet set-up with fresh hummus and roasted vegetables. But it closed its doors before it became a habit for me.

I didn't bother reviewing this location since Bindi because by the time I was ready to write something, it changed into something else. But now Mehfil is trying to buck the odds and open their third restaurant at this location, even though their Folsom location is less than three blocks away. My friend Linda and I decided to try the new Mehfil on the second day of their operation, and it was a mixed experience for us and frankly a state of divine chaos. The staff was running around in a semi-crazed state forgetting to close out transactions and just not paying attention to the customers. Hopefully it will calm down to a more comfortable routine for them. Linda tried the $7 Tandoori Chicken Tikka Salad and felt it missed the mark considerably.

The slice of chicken tikka adraki was quite dried out despite having been marinated in yogurt. The spring mix, iceberg lettuce, cucumber, tomato, carrots and red bell peppers were reasonable enough, but she found the house-made Mehfil-E-Mango dressing indigestible. I went for the $5 vegetarian twofer of Channa Saag and Laganshala over rice (see photo). The Channa Saag is a chickpea and spinach puree which was tasty but a tad too oily for my taste, while the Laganshala is a vegetable stew of cauliflower, carrots, potatoes, and green beans seasoned with a number of spices. The latter was easily the best dish because it was the simplest. I'll probably wait a while before coming back since their opening week jitters started to get on my nerves.

FOOD - 3 stars...the laganshala saved the meal, the rest of it needs work
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...same weird bi-level space that makes no sense to me
SERVICE - 2 stars...chaos is the word of the day
TOTAL - 3 stars...barely holing onto 3 stars but I hate it to be the next in a long line of casualties at this address
author: Ed U.

description: My husband and I went here for dinner the butter chicken was amazing! We'll definitely be back! Fast and friendly service it was great!
author: Amy B.

description: This place recently raised their veggie lunch special to $6. The food is OK,  but the extra $2 for Naan makes it less attractive then other Indian restaurants. This is a good option if your in hurry for the most part.
author: Jay P.

description:
Mehfil was one of the options given to me by my friend for lunch today, as it was his turn to choose the place. The first option was Togo's, and since I would rather lick the sidewalk than eat Togo's (why? Personal opinion: it's awful, I don't like chains, and depending on the day, it's either Subway's pretty cousin or ugly little sister, - ain't guna cut it, especially with all the awesome sandwich shops in the Financial), so we went with Mehfil.

I've been to Mehfil before, but it was in the pre-historic times when my palate was so immature and my stomach was so small; I think I actually ordered one piece of naan, and that was my lunch, not kidding. Since I've become a real human, I wanted to give it another go, and today I had a craving for Chicken Tikka Massala. And that is what I got.

Lunch special for this dish is $7, plus $1 for hot, charred naan which is always my favorite part of the dish. So $8, not too bad, it's cash only. My friend only had his lucky dollar, and I had $5, so the cashier let it slide and told us to come back another time and pay the rest. 

Also, pretty sure they do cash only for the lunch specials because they are trying to dump old food, but I can't really complain. 

OR CAN I?!? The chicken in my dish was very dry and there was waaay too much rice, which was also dry. What am I supposed to do after all these carbs? Take a food-induced nap at my desk? I saved half, so I have a snack or dinner later. The Tikka Massala sauce was flavorful, but lacked heat. Made me fondly think back on Naan 'N Curry near Jackson that has now, sadly, been closed.
author: Crystal C.

description: Two stars for the food - decent if it actually was delivered timely. I've ordered a few times and the last two occasions took 2hrs and 1.5hrs to deliver, respectively. Needless to say the food was worm at best at this point. I also had to call them and check on the delivery status and the two excuses I got were "traffic" and "car broke down, getting another car." I guess I'll have to find another Indian food joint where I can spend money or just not deal with the awful delivery service in San Francisco at all. Oh yes, forgot to mention, I live about 15 minutes walk away from these guys - not like I am on the other end of town.
author: Assen D.

description:
It's a love hate type of thing.

I love Mehfil. Part of me screams 5 stars every time I see it. That's my impatient part, which loves the fact that you can be in and out of Mehfil in legit *one minute*.

But I also hate Mehfil for being so sporadic in its menu. I'm sure its great for people who like meat, but for me, what I crave is the paneer bhurji. Unfortunately, they've only ever served it once :(. Just kidding, they probably served it more than once, but the lunch menu is mostly different every day (mostly because they always always always have chicken tikka masala), and paneer bhurji is just never there when I check.

Mehfil is certainly an experience to try out. The food is pretty delish if they happen to have what you like. Today I checked the menu for paneer bhurji, but found bengan bhartha instead. So today it's a 3 star.
author: Sahil P.

description:
I've worked in the FiDi for over two years now and can confidently say that the $5 lunch special is the best value for lunch downtown. I eat a lot, and many places that cost twice the price do not fill me up (looking at you salads!). To be able to be relatively full (not too too full) for $5 is cheaper than I can make at home and bring in. 

It is pretty basic with just rice and a topping, but the quality is pretty high and the spices/tastes are spot on. 

One tip- ask for a combo of two options that you like and you usually can get a bit more variety. I will be back many times.
author: Ted L.

description:
I've always loved the Mehfil over on Folsom St because they had such a great lunch special, but it was a bit of a hike. With this new location, the new Mehfil will be one of my go-to spots. 

The lunch special is great $5-$6 ($5 for vegetarian, $6 for meat dishes). There are 5-6 options to choose from, and there's typically a chicken tikka masala on the menu. It's a great value as the lunches are a good size. And these lunch specials are to-go only. 

The layout of this location is a bit odd as you have to walk all the way through to the back of the restaurant to get to the lunch specials and when I was there, the line was really starting to build by 12:15. The line moves quickly since all of the food is pre-made, but it is a bit annoying to have to wait in two lines (one for the food, one to pay).
author: Wendy L.

description: I had the Daal Makhani on the Meal Pal menu.  This is the first time I have had something at Meal pal that I didn't like.  It was just plain and not enough food.  I later got some sushi.  I walked a few good miles to get here.  I am not a picky eater, but it just was not good.
author: Winston O.

description: Mehfil Indian is located walking distance from the Palace Hotel.  I could not find anything open close to the Palace Hotel and the concierge told me that Mehfil was open late.  The restaurant layout is narrow and has two levels.  The FOOD however is STELLAR.  I tried the Salmon Achaari aka Fish Achaari.  It's a unique recipe consisting of fennel seeds,. mustard seeds, onion, cumin, garlic and tomato in a pureed gravy.  The fish was Salmon and together with the Achaari gravy was the BEST Indian seafood experience I have ever tried!  I started with vegetable samosas and washed it all down with Taj Beer from India.  Please note I have been indulging in Indian cuisine for 20 years and have had eaten Indian food in Mumbai, Pune, Jaipur, Delhi, Agra, NYC, San Francisco, Boston, Miami etc.  The place has delicious food!  The manager and the waitress were exuding some kind of romantic tension vibe and the cook was a long white bearded gentleman who carefully watched his food creations come to life like an artist  The service and food are EXCELLENT!  The atmosphere is average.  Get caught up in the authentic Indian vibe.  This is a place for foodies and adventurers.  So stay home if you are an elitist or a food snob.  GREAT family run vibe.
author: David H.

description:
This is a decent lunch place, I'd say. They give you a lot of food and the prices aren't outrageous.  It should also be said that finding a place to sit and eat in a work lunch timeframe can be a tall order in this neighborhood.

We had Samosas, which were great, and two kinds of naan. All of that was pretty fantastic. But the curry is bland.
That's just not okay.
author: Justin A.

description: This was the best Indian food I've had so far in SF. I've tried about 7 other places via delivery (Mehfil was delivered too) and this has been my favorite so far. Ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Paneer, with Garlic Naan
author: Michael L.

description: Not sure why this place has only 3.5 stars. Probably must be the service. I have only ordered delivery from this place and I have to say that this is the best palak paneer and malai kofta I have ever had. Tried the food at couple other Indian restaurants nearby which are also good, but this one by far takes the cake. I keep repeating the above two dishes so cannot comment on the whole menu, but these deserve 5 stars. Will be trying paneer makhani and biryani next time. Let's see.
author: Raj S.

description: Desperately looking for cheap tasty (un)healthy indian food in FiDI?? Look no more. 6 dollars, fast lines, and already in a takeout box. I recommend any of their chicken curries. You do NOT want to spend extra money on a side of naan, it is stale and bland! Head on to the back of the restaurant during lunch hours and they'll hook you up.
author: Menisha V.

description:
I'm not sure what just happened. I was seriously craving curry and I've walked past this place for months. I finally had a longer lunch and decided to go in. Inside was much nicer than I expected. I got there at 11:15am... I walked in and was completely ignored. I honestly thought they weren't open. A girl gave me a menu once i asked her, I'm not even sure if she worked there, but the rest of the staff completely ignored me. It was the lunch menu but with none of the specials from the signs outside. Which was fine because I knew what I wanted to order. I waited ten minutes or so while everyone was running around creating deliveries or on the phone before I walked out. 

I was really looking forward to curry, but I don't think I'll be back. 

Don't come here before noon I guess. Seems their delivery business is pretty intense.
author: Lara E.

description:
Food was very tasty when I went in and sat down for dinner. Not sure about the pricing, but it wasn't overly expensive. Good service.

However, when I went and got to-go at lunch the quality was definitely not as good, but the price was only $5 or $6. You definitely get what you pay for at this place. I would probably only recommend lunch if you're really craving Indian and you need it really fast.
author: Kyle K.

description: I literally LOVED this food; AMAZING service; super super clean premises; EXTREMELY welcoming; if I could give this 7 stars out of 5, I ABSOLUTELY would.
author: Connor M.

description:
This is my favorite lunch/dinner spot. Decently priced for the quality of the food. I haven't tasted anything I didn't like. 

Samosas are the best here. I don't know what the sauces that come with it are, but they're all really good. 

I also wish I remembered the names of the dishes I like to get, but I don't. They have an awesome happy hour, $4-$5 for beer, but with how good the food is, I almost have no room for beer. 

My coworker and I always split an appetizer and main dish, and between the two of us, the bill comes out to $6-7 bucks each. That's a deal in the Financial District.

Their menu also changes day-to-day, which I think is a great way to keep fans coming back. I know i'll keep coming back/
author: Nicolle B.

description: Was craving butter chicken but the chicken tikka masala was close enough.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
I've never dined in-- I assume the rating is due to service, because the food is so good!! This is my go-to delivery place when I'm missing home or just want comfort food.

I'm super picky with my indian food, in particular the consistency of saag, which most places get wrong (oily, too pureed, too watery, etc). Mehfil has the best saag paneer  in the city, and I have tried a LOT of places. If you ask for it spicy, it will be spicy.  Shahi paneer is also delicious here, and their naan is very moist.
author: Sonia H.

description:
I passed the place 3 times before going inside. My third pass I noticed and Indian couple eating inside so I said. "Must be decent." 
When they were leaving I asked where they were from and they said Delhi.
They heard about the restaurant from Indian friends and family.
Enough said so go eat wonderful Indian in SF. 
Ron
author: Ron g.

description:
We came here for a work lunch because Amber was super full (might be due to a convention or something). We ordered off the a la cart menu and that was a mistake. The food took FOREVER to come out!! Our waitress was a space cadet too, although she seemed nice, but she just seemed like she was somewhere else.

We shared a few naans, the saag paneer, the chicken vindaloo and the lamb biriyani. The food was very good -- it was flavorful and they fished out most of the whole spices so I didn't end up with a grenade in my mouth that I had to find a polite way to spit out in front of my coworkers. 

For the money, I would much MUCH rather do the lunch buffet at Amber.
author: Alice W.

description: I ordered a chicken biryani from here and it's the worst peice of crap I ever ate. The raita was spilled on the rice during delivery, it tasted like feet. Never coming to this dump.
author: Raghavendra B.

description:
The $5 dollar lunch special is great! Average quality Indian food. 

Keep in mind there usually is a long line during lunch but it goes by quickly.
author: Ashwin M.

description: Really good Indian food and you can have lunch boxes staring 5$ with rice and yummy vegetable! For the lunch deals there is not much choice but considering the speed and the price: Great!
author: Irina P.

description: First let's start with the positive- the tikka masala was tasty! Just the right combination of spicy and good round flavored. The rice, was fine. The naan, was disappointing because two of my four pieces weren't fully baked and still doughy. There wasn't really any ambience, which is just fine I'm not picky about that. Service was quick to take my order and deliver it but took forever to get my check.
author: Amber R.

description:
My co-worker took me here for lunch on my first day (yay corporate expense account!) and we really enjoyed the food. There's some interesting stuff here even on the lunch menu that a lot of Indian places don't have.

We both decided to do combos of one whole dish and a second half-dish (for $5.99). She got the Tandoori Salmon and Bhindi Masala, and I got the Punjabi Goat Curry and Laganshala. We also both got Zafrani Lassis, because I'd heard that was the unique thing to get here.

All of the dishes were tasty, but the salmon took the cake for most aromatic. It came on a sizzling plate and smelled wonderful--fish mixed with an array of exotic spices combined with vegetables. It was pretty delicious, though I couldn't have eaten an entire dish of it as it was quite rich. If you're not an okra fan like me, skip the Bhindi Masala. No amount of spices can cover up that slimy saliva texture. Yuck! The Goat Curry was a little spicy and very tasty, with tender pieces of goat meat. The Laganshala sounded great, but seemed kind of....bland....to me. If you are a fan of the original tart froyo flavor, you should definitely try the Zafrani Lassi, which has the same tart creaminess with a bonus of other fruity flavors and spices.

Despite the fact that we had a "sit-down" lunch, the food came out really fast. Yet, we were allowed to enjoy at our leisure without ever feeling rush. Praises for the service are definitely warranted--the people who work here are exceptionally friendly and hospitable.
author: Josephine L.

description: Despite their menu claiming dishes are served with rice they aren't delivered that way via Uber Eats (or other delivery services for that matter). To make things worse, when we called to ask about this after not having rice delivered they were rude as could be on the phone and claimed the menu says nothing about rice with the dishes, even though it clearly does. Will never order from or eat here again.
author: Nate D.

description:
It's interesting I've been coming here and ordering delivery from this place for close to 3 years now. I used to go here for lunch both to eat at the buffet, order from the lunch plate area and delivery for both home and work. Since I've moved jobs now it's primarily delivery for at home but we've ordered for work lunches and the experience has been the same.

Let's start with the lunch experience. You could get a quick inexpensive rice and another option for 6 to 7 bucks and you're in and out for those on the go. The other option was to grab a to go plate and you could grab from the same buffet that you could grab from if you ate there. I've done both and both are solid.

Delivery. By far this place has been the best delivery restaurant of any cuisine I've ordered from. It's the only place that consistently delivers before the stated time. Most places are always late which I understand because SF is a hard city to get around, which amazes me even more that this place is further than some of the restaurants we order from and they still deliver in half the time.
