Now the food. It is consistently good. I've ordered a ton from here and I've yet to have a time where my wife or anyone made any comments about "hmm this time something is off". 

I have to say it makes sense. I recall the owner was the one usually at the cashier during busy lunches. He was always friendly and you could tell he made an effort to make sure people were taken care of.
author: Hyung L.

description: We had our early dinner here. Place is cleana and ambience is good. We ordered paneer chickpeas. It tasted like they just boiled and served it. No salt or any taste of spices. Rice were also half cooked. Was not a very good experience.
author: Nik K.

description: My office is right next door, so this has become my No. 1 lunch spot. For $8, you get a big bowl of excellent chicken tikka masala, plus better-than-average naan. There are other lunch specials daily, but I've tried very few of them (the saag paneer is great; wish they had it more often). Highly recommended.
author: Noah T.

description: Naan pretty good. Saag paneer okay. Lamb vindaloo was alright. Was busy during lunch hour near financial district. Service was fine and food came quickly.
author: Swapan M.

description:
biggest bang for your buck in my opinion around fidi for a dellicious and filling lunch!

the bento box to go is about $6 depending on what you entree you get with the rice, and it's enough food to fill your empty growling stomach and to put you to sleep in the afternoon. 

i usually get half chicken tikka masala and half a vegetarian option, and ask for it spicy - they sprinkle some nomsies powder that will sure make you red in the face! teehee.  also, a trick is to get a side of tikka sauce in a smaller container (they charge $1 extra) - its soooo worth it! then you can drown all your delicious rice in that sauuuceeee! mmmmmm! i pretty much have this once every two weeks. 

#tikkatuesday ftw.
author: Christina L.

description: Best to go place for Indian food in a very reasonable  price during lunch time in San Francisco.
author: Kalyani S.

description:
I came here for lunch with a few friends. They have a different menu everyday. We opted for the sit down experience, but I think it's more bang for your buck if you take it to go.

Everyone ordered different dishes to try, including a vegetarian dish, lamb, chicken mushroom, and chicken tikka masala. All the entrees were delicious. The lamb was nice and tender, and the vegetarian dish had a nice heartiness to it. The tikka masala had delicious sauce, but the chicken mushroom's chicken was a lot more tender. The dishes came with a small serving of lentil soup, plates of "salad" that were cucumbers and tomatoes, naan and basmati rice. We were all pretty stuffed and satisfied after our meals. The total came out to be around $15 per person including tax and tip.

I think the food here is great, but it's a bit overpriced, especially for sit down. When you takeout, you get basmati rice with your choice of curry over the rice. It's a pretty big portion for around $6-7 which I think is much more worth it. I'd recommend this place, but take out only.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Worse food ever. Do your self a favor and pick something else. A slice of pizza from anywhere will be better then this. Main ingredient in food is water. Chicken Tikka Masala watery and lassi was yogurt flavor water. Pathetic! 

Check the lassi I poured into a bowl to show how bad it was and its almost like cheating customers. 

Seriously this is what they call lassi!!!! 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EfY_NvnaUyc&feature=youtu.be
author: Nitesh J.

description: Good alternative - but Mehfil gets a 1-star for ambiance and warmth for a dining establishment.  I walk down 2nd street every morning and most mornings as I pass by their window at 6:50 AM, the front booth by the sidewalk window is full of dirty plates, silverware, napkins and glasses from either the evening before - or the evening before that!  Sorry, but if the management cannot clean up after themselves, so the restaurant looks presentable as hundreds and hundreds of people pass by early in the AM, I wonder what the kitchen or back area looks like?  Is it clean?  I will post a picture next time I see...
author: GJ C.

description: First time here, had the $5 shahi paneer lunch special w/ rice. Seems like demand up and quality down?
author: Shruti D.

description:
Are you kidding me? I can get a decent Indian meal at lunch for $5? Why couldn't I have found this place earlier?

They usually have 5 lunch specials, ranging from $5-$7. Two vegetarian dishes and three non-vegetarian that change every day.

I'll admit, it's not the best Indian food you've ever tasted, but for $5 it's great.
author: Greg A.

description:
I read the one review about seeing a big bottle of food coloring out in the open, and it's not that I didn't believe him, it's more that I didn't think it would be THAT blatant!

I walked up to the counter to get lunch takeout and there it was sitting on the counter in front of the kitchen right next to the take out menu with the label facing the customers (see picture). Yup, that's a big old bottle of orange food coloring. INTERESTING!

I will say that I've only gotten takeout lunches from here and the chicken tikka is acceptable and cheap. It's not great: the chicken is almost always dry, the chunks are too big to cut up with the flimsy plastic fork you get, but for a quick lunch it's "acceptable". No more, no less.

I wouldn't go in and sit down to eat here.
author: Sarah S.

description: Great customer service!!! Aman there is always polite and very courteous. Their naan is always fresh & when I get it delivered, it always come really warm! Their chicken biryani is also good, the chicken is always fresh. I've never had a meal from there where I've been disappointed. Can't wait to try more food items here!!
author: Sonya L.

description:
Took over two hours to get delivery.  
Last time I ordered they forgot something. Should have learned from their first mistake.
author: cheryl R.

description:
Came here last week with my friend for lunch. the food is aite.. the service is kinda slow. they do give you a good portion... plenty of carbs lol. Naan AND rice.
the soup that comes with the special is yucky. lol no flavor.

we had the cranberry chicken. It was ok.. definitely not my most favorite thing in the world. I don't know if i will be coming back... =/
author: Judy W.

description: Cheap, tasty, fast, Indian food.  For a fast lunch, walk straight to the back and order one of the 5 dishes.  Also, you can mix 2 of the dishes together.  Don't forget to order a Naan by the register.  Also, paying with cash is cheaper.  My friends love the red sauce too (also at the register).
author: Ryan I.

description: The lunch box is a steal here $5-6 out the door but cash only so be sure not to be banking on your credit card. I can't speak for the sit in experience but would recommend the tikka masala box. I wish I could review the other boxes but each time I go I'm just too tempted by the sweet sweet tikka masala.
author: Alex R.

description:
I had the 5$ veggie lunch box.I bought 2 of them and apparently this is the only item that is CASH ONLY !! WTF!! You take cards for everything else and when i bought something for $10 you say CASH ONLY..! ? I ended up paying couple bucks extra to pay with card..

Next I was about to sit and eat my lunch and they say, I need to sit outside and eat as its a lunch boX. Again, WTFFF!!!

Rude Sh!t.. PLEASE AVOID..
author: Karteek P.

description: Gross...sat down and a roach crawled past my shoulder. So gross. We showed the waitress and she pretended it wasn't there. We walked out.
author: Chris K.

description: I well like to say that they have very good food had the chicken tikka and the kabob and naan chicken was fresh and the food was really good need to go back in and try more food oh the sweets are good after you had a good meal  I tell all my friends go try the food you'll wana go back for more...
author: Sunny M.

description:
This review is for service only:

I was in there packing up food for a to go order and the waiter was overbearing and rude. I did not use their supplies nor did I ask for help, but the manager insisted on arguing with me about adding saran wrap to their "leak proof" container. I was biking and needed to make sure nothing spilled inside my backpack. Lastly, THEY forgot an item and once I returned for it the manager found it permissible to scold me. FIRST, I was a customer. SECOND, they should not blame customers for their own mistake. THIRD, if they treat customers like this they must treat their staff worse.

I refuse to patronize restaurants that do not respect people and if they feel comfortable being overtly rude they must care little about the quality of food and care at their establishment.
author: M M.

description: Food wasn't that flavorful, not spicy at all. Service was horrible. Asked for a napkin, water for my wife and I two separate times. Never got it. My wife had to wait in line at the bar to get water.
author: Rowan P.

description:
I love this place, the lunch specials are really nice.
TASTY TASTY TASTY
GOOD GOOD GOOD
author: Simran B.

description: Great food and service, not to mention the food is very well prepared and healthy. i highly recommend this place for a great Indian Meal!!!!!
author: Bobby B.

description:
These guys are just the worse.

Went in with a team from work to sit for lunch. Everyone was dirty, food quality was low, and the staff was lacking basic manners.

Won't be back to this place.
author: Restaurant C.

description: I have this at least once a month. A bit pricey, but pretty darn good so you don't mind paying the extra few dollars.
author: Kimberly N.

description: I have been ordering from Mehfil for several years.  They have historically been very prompt with their deliveries, and the food has been excellent.  In the past couple of months, however, the service has declined dramatically.  I have had several orders in the past few weeks where the delivery took over an hour, and the restaurant is only two blocks from my home.  When I called, I was told the driver was on his way.  When I called again after 30 minutes, I was told the same thing.  Tonight was the final straw - nothing delivered after 40 minutes, and when I called to inquire, I was told the "driver is outside my door."  20 minutes later, the driver arrived with my order, MINUS ANY RICE.  I don't know what has happened here with Mehfil, but I'm done ordering from them.  Their service and quality has declined dramatically. Very disappointing.
author: Sig L.

description:
They're super cheap and fast, especially for a place in the financial district. They also deliver consistently on time. 

Their naan is good. While it's not mind-blowing or anything, it's correctly made, and that's all I ask. As for their curry though, while the flavors are there, the meat is usually overcooked and manages to be dry, and the vegetables are just flavorless. 

Maybe a good option for those looking to save money, a quick bite, or just something to fill you up. Not so much if you're looking for quality.
author: Alan Y.

description:
This place is a good place if you want to sit down and grab some indian food quickly. However, the Chicken Tika Masala was okay but I felt it was a little bit overpriced.

Atmosphere and service was excellent though
author: Alvin Y.

description:
Bottom Line: One of the best tasting restaurants around and it is unbelievably inexpensive, $5!

This is excellent food and one of my favorite spots for lunch. The lunch box is $5 dollars for veggie and $6 for meat combo. Naan is another dollar but you really don't need it because you get a ton of food. I recommend getting the veggie combo because it is so savory and filling. The food is so comforting; you can feel the love in the cooking.

I guess the only downside is that lunch is cash only so just keep a twenty at your office desk so you don' miss out.
author: Matthew T.

description: Some people just love this place, but I found the seasoning on the dishes to be a bit mild for my taste.  They have a nice deal at lunch, served family style.  We did not leave hungry.  I can't think of a better Indian option in this area.
author: Patrick S.

description: Friendly people, delicious food. and the lunch takeout special is an exceptional deal! They vary the selection daily (besides a few mainstays like their chicken tikka masala) which keeps me coming back to try something new. I should mention, they're lunch box service is exceptionally fast during the financial district's lunch rush, so it's a good option when you're in a hurry.
author: Brendan D.

description: So happy I found this place! Close to my work, fast service. Cheap lunch box; 6.00 chicken tikka masala.  The food was packed  hot to order, good portion, and most importantly, spicy delicious! YUM...I need my Indian food fix sometimes!
author: Marvella W.

description: I've been coming here for a quick and easy lunch for the last couple years and am very happy with the Chicken Tikka Masala. Head to the back counter, get a bowl of CTM over rice, grab some naan, and then pay $8 at the middle counter. There's never a line and you are in and out in under 5 minutes. They usually have a vegetarian option and some other rotating lunch options, something with meatballs that is pretty tasty too.
author: Matt B.

description:
I wouldn't say this is the best indian food, but I always go to the back of the restaurant and get the take-out. Maybe the sit down, fresh food is better. 

Lunch special is $5 and naan is $2. It says cash only, but i usually just use my card and they charge an extra dollar. Mehfil is right across the street from my office so it's very convenient. 

I have yet to try anything other than the chicken tikka masala, but it's pretty good
author: Jordan S.

description:
Came here today because I've heard about their awesome cheap lunch to go options. Mehfil doesn't disappoint! Just walked in to the back and ordered the chicken tikka masala. The guy filled a to go container with basmati rice then added the tikka masala right on top. He gave me my order then I walked over to the counter to pay. It's cash only for this deal so it was only $5. I hear if you add naan it's only $8.

Super delish tikka masala that hit the spot on a cold rainy day. I definitely would want to come back to try their other lunch specials! Quick, cheap and satisfying lunch is hard to find downtown!
author: Christine W.

description:
Happy camper after this meal!  Ordered take-out via telephone and went to pick it up.  The food was ready in about 15 minutes and nicely packaged so nothing leaked.  The smell of the garlic hummus alone made me want to just eat right then and there.  When I went inside I noticed that the inside is very spacious - not fancy by any means but very casual and has a cafeteria kind of feel.  But, very nice staff!  When I went at 6:30pm on a Sunday it was nearly empty but there were a lot of take-out orders on the counter.  I'm a vegetarian so the following was ordered: 

**Kachumber Salad $3.50
Diced cucumber and vine ripened tomatoes mixed with spices and lemon juice.
Saag Paneer $9.95 (so good with great mix of spices and lemon. no oil!) 
**Home made cottage cheese cubes cooked with fresh spinach leaves with a little yogurt, ginger, garlic, and tomatoes. Served with Indian basmati rice. (this is good everywhere and this place was no different - great flavor)
**Aloo Bengan $8.95
Eggplants cooked with red onions, ginger, garlic, and vine ripened tomatoes with white potatoes. Served with Indian basmati rice. (YUM!!)
**Malai Kofta $9.95
Assortment of fresh vegetables mashed together and mixed with home made cottage cheese formed in cylindrically shaped dumplings cooked in a base gravy of saffron, cashews, ginger, garlic, tomatoes, and garam masala. Served with Indian basmati rice. (Indian meatballs in a delicious cream sauce - delish)

Definitely will be ordering more food from this place!
author: Naomi P.

description:
TL; DR: Great food! Slow delivery, broken online UI.

Ordered using their online tool for the next day. Didn't get an email response confirming order. Emailed their info@ address, and got a bounce back. Called the next day and was told the order went through. Confirmed order and delivery time, everything was great!

Until their driver got lost and was about 45 minutes late. Since this was for a meeting I was running that wasn't great. And we've gotten delivery from them before, which is was why I ordered from them in the first place. So that wasn't pleasant, especially when they told me the driver was in the building when he wasn't (I checked with security and reception).

Again, their food is great. But this experience was stressful and my meeting was going to be stressful without exterior stressors. I may order from them again, because their food is very tasty, but I will think twice about it.
author: Jacob R.

description:
Very disappointed at the service of this place.  My Wife and I have eaten here before and decided to do take-out.  The food is not bad not spectacular.   My experience for this review is related to the service.  

Today is a North Indian religious day called Karva Chauth.  The main focus of this day is my wife fasts the whole day until the full moon comes out.  So basically she was very hungry by the time it was time to eat.   I called made a take out order on the phone to time it with when the full moon shows.  We drove to pick the food up and they stated there was no order put in.   Then they managed to be very rude about it after the fact to my starving wife.  I understand mistakes are made but then fix the mistake make the food right there!   We ended up paying extra and getting a great meal from Amber that was ready and packed for us in 15 minutes.  

We wont be coming back to this pace!
author: Aseem n.

description:
Always get the chicken tikka masala to go lunch box for $6 which is a good deal for the area and it's pretty good. 

However, service is lacking - I always greet the gentlemen in the back serving the food however they do not respond and simply state "Next." Also, is 10 cents for a bag necessary at a location that serves food and doesn't even enter the bag into the cash register system?
author: Nikhil V.

description: I finally tried this place after a co-worker suggested this restaurant for food. I love hot & peppery Indian food. I was very happy they were open in the evening on a Saturday. I was attending a nearby gallery that does not serve food, I came to get a quick bite. I ordered my standard Saag Paneer which comes with rice included and a Taj Mahal. It looked good and was fresh but I asked for it to be super spicy & hot and it came salted perfectly but with no pepper heat whatsoever.  This makes me not want to come back for fear it would be bland.
author: Infodiva B.

description: some of the best indian food i've had in a while and very reasonably priced! cute space and the staff is also very friendly. kind of hard to find in a car and trying to figure out parking though. you could blink and you'd miss it.  but still, very quaint little space.
author: Sam C.

description: This place was great! I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala lunch bowl and it was so delicious. Just the perfect amount of spiciness and it was very flavorful. You can't beat a  $5-7 lunch in the financial district, its quite a gem!
author: Gabriela S.

description:
9pm on a Sunday night in the Financial District = slim pickings if you're starving, and that is when and how I found myself. Mehfil was super close to my hotel, but I went on a mile detour because I left my hotel headed in the wrong direction. On the upside, I got some exercise, worked up even more of an appetite and tested the safety of the Financial District streets as a lone woman. 

When I finally arrived, I was the only customer, but I was greeted quickly and warmly. I ordered the Vegetable Korma and was pleased to see that they don't get ya with a la carte rice. I ordered roti to accompany my curry. I thought the korma was delicious filled with a variety of vegetables and raisins for sweetness. I had no problem finishing the entire bowl on my own. I see in the other reviews that they have a very affordable lunch option, and I would definitely give that a try if I happen to be back in the area and looking for a lunch spot.
author: Misti Y.

description:
I have walked by this place many times, but never stopped in. Today I was craving Indian food, so I stopped in to buy their lunch special. Walk all the way to the back and choose one of 6 options--for either $5 or $6. I chose Chicken Tikka Masala over rice and received a  huge portion for $6. The person behind me asked for half/half, which I had wished I knew about because I like a little variety! Next time!

The CTM was o.k. --they use breast meat, but the pieces are so huge they are somewhat tough and don't have the opportunity to simmer in the yummy sauce. If they cut the chicken smaller, it would be easier to eat and you would get chicken in every bite!

You pay (in cash) at the bar where you have the option of adding naan for $2--sort of a rip off, but I didn't realize there was an extra charge until I received $2 back, instead of $4.

I'll be back to try out some of the other dishes. A fast, cheap lunch in the FD!
author: Mrs P.

description:
$5 for lunch holy Jesus that is amazing.  It's also stupid fast.  The Indian is decent, not perfect.  But the price makes it pretty unreal of a deal, kind of a steal.

Whenever I go here I seem to get mehfil of decent Indian at an even more decent price.  Recommended as an inexpensive lunch option!
author: Alex H.

description:
The combination of price, location and quality is simply amazing. Depending on what you ask for, you can grab lunch quickly and as cheap as $5. Since I'm a vegetarian I had to opt for a slightly more expensive option at $6.50, but God do they deliver incredibly well for that price point.
You should definitely try it out if you're in the area; I have not tried eating at the restaurant itself, but it looks a log bigger than many other established places around the city.
author: Dinesh H.

description: I told a coworker that I wasn't into Indian food. He said this place would change my mind. He was right! I tried the butter chicken and spinach and both were delish!
author: Lindsey B.

description:
I only come for the $5 vegetarian cash only take out lunch....since I am vegetarian and only need lunch in this hood.  On days when there is something with saag,  they get 6 stars.  Days without spinach but maybe daal or chana, 3-4 stars.   Other days I just don't bother coming in as vegetables on rice is not a lasting meal, which puts the "meh" in "Mehfil.".

They used to have their daily menu online so you could plan in advance, but not anymore.  Fortunately most days they post the menu in the window.

Fellow take-outers, please get your money ready while standing in the line to pay.   You know the drill!   Thanks!
author: Ellie Y.

description: Used to be on folsom street and moved to new location. Never had their fast and cheap lunch specials but have been there a few times for dinner at the new location. Like their vegetarian paneer saag and chicken korma
author: Kenneth L.

description:
Amazing takeout lunchtime special. Chicken Tikka Masala for $5 - great quality and quantity.

I am British and love a good curry. This hit the spot on a budget with no lunchtime waiting
author: John G.

description:
Best Indian take out in the area! Every time I come here, I'm greeted and even winked at. They have three locations, prices are great, and the food is awesome. 

Three wise tips is all you need: 

+Walk to the back and get lunch take out of Chicken Tikka Masala that comes in a bowl with rice (I've tried everything, it's the best) - $6
+Purchase Naan - $2
+Pay with Cash (Avoid $1 fee)
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I have a very sensitive stomach to different food types, but I can say is I have tried almost everything on the menu and it is amazing. The flavor of all the dishes is so tasty.  

Great place to get a quick bite after work..
author: Jonathan G.

description: Some of the best indian food I've ever had! My favorite go-to place when I'm craving some saag paneer and chicken tikka masala. The customer service is great - the staff is friendly and attentive! I definitely recommend Mehfil to everyone I can!
author: Japjot B.

description:
I finally got around to trying this place yesterday for lunch.  I was drawn in by all the Yelp reviews about the yummy to go lunch specials that change daily.  And the price!  Between $5-7 for lunch?  Oh yeah!

They update their menu online every day so you can decide what you want before you even step foot inside.  Head to the back of the restaurant where you can see the piping hot food behind the counter.  I opted for the chicken cranberry, which was similar to tikka masala but with dried cranberries added.  For $6 I got a generous heap of chicken cranberry, rice, & fresh naan.  The chicken was tender & the chunks were huge!  I ended up only eating half of the naan since the portions were so large.  They also serve wraps & have a few vegetarian options.  

I did notice that they charge $1 if you pay for your to go order with a credit card, so be sure to bring cash.  For $6 you won't need much of it!
author: Erin S.

description: We got food here for Diwali and it was disappointing. The aloo bengan and channa was OK. The meat was bad, especially the chicken which was undercooked and chewy. I will pass, too many other good options for Indian and Pakistani in the neighborhood.
author: Sunil R.

description:
I'm not the biggest fan of Indian Food and totally left this off my list for a number of years. My wife is big on Indian food and using her ways of subtle and constant manipulation she was able to get me to go to Dosa. I have a whole separate review on Dosa but that re-experience of Indian food changed my outlook towards the cuisine itself. Maybe my palate matured or maybe it just took me that long to get over the very last experience that floored me for a couple days.
 
Mehfil is completely different from Dosa. It's a good experience and probably one of the better values in the Financial. They have a menu that is constantly updated. All the food comes hot and fresh. They provide everyone with a small cup of tasty lentil soup and a starter salad to be shared by the table. They also bring out naan for the table to use for scooping up the delicious sauces. I've had their tandoori chicken and prawns and both are excellent. Their masalas are also excellent. It's tasty and affordable. It's best to get in before 11:30 on a normal day. But they do have quite a number of tables. 

I gave them 4 stars and they are a superb restaurant for their target market. They are great for a quick or extended sit down lunch. The servers are friendly and again you can't beat the solid prices.
author: Ryan C.

description:
The price is cheap and so is the food...
1. Uncdercooked rice- gave me Tummy Ache :(
2. NO CASH? Have to PAY 1$ extra ???

Not going to this place again!!
author: Vinoothna G.

description: They are in this area from long time, I have picked Togo boxes from more than 3 years. Location has changed but taste is same. Most affordable I the SF downtown area. Their menu changes everyday so you can pick boxes for whole week. Same items if you dine-in its costly. Like this place.
author: Anurag M.

description:
I came here for lunch with my buddies on a Friday. We ordered from their lunch menu which changes daily. The dish comes with basmati rice, naan, salad and a small cup of lentil soup. 

I ordered paneer bhurji ($9.95). This is the first time I had this dish so I may not have a good benchmark. The dish is flavorful from coriander powder, turmeric and cumin seeds. Paneer is mashed well with the curry, diced tomatoes and green peas. The portion is quite generous, so it kept me full until late evening.

You can ask for more rice or naan if you want more.
author: Saran R.

description:
Its hard to beat $5(veg) lunch combo(2 entree + rice)

My favorite here is Dal followed by  saag paneer.

They only have 2 veggie items everyday. Some items are not good.
author: Hari M.

description:
Sweet deal.

Food: Cubed chicken cooked in yogurt and spices, topped with sweetened dried cranberries and served atop rice. Lots of chicken and quite a bit of spice.  Good.

Price: One of a few lunch specials for $5. Changes each day. Great.

Three stars for the food. Five for the price.
author: Jason B.

description:
Delicious food, awesome staff.

Would totally recommend to anyone looking for a tasty lunch in the city.

Ordered 3 dishes, 5 arrived. Two of them on the house. Naan was wonderful.

I'm so full, time for a nap.
author: Christine M.

description:
3 Stars because I have had good experiences in the past but based on my recent visits I'd give it 1 star. 

I always seem to order the same entree at this restaurant. Kadhai Paneer or Dal Makhani, Rice and Naan. The Kadhai Paneer is great and one of the best I've had in the bay area however off late I've noticed that the entrees seem to be lacking taste and the service is getting really bad. I had to wait for 20 minutes for a waiter to show up after we got the table, wait another 50 minutes for the food to arrive after we ordered the food. The waiter forgot the order and asked us to confirm the entrees when we asked him whats taking so long. 

Dont get fooled by the sign that reads we change our menu everyday. Well the menu literally changes but the food is the same with a new name every day.
author: Rahul P.

description:
I'm giving 5 stars for the lunch grab n go $5-6.  (I haven't been to the sit-down yet, but I think I need to try that salmon)

The best Saag Aloo I've ever had! Over a rice bowl with the cranberry chicken, a lighter version of chicken tikka masala. They will make a combo of any 2 items for the same price as 1. Great deal SUPER fast, all the other luch spots had big lines...maybe I just lucked out. YUM! I'll be back!
author: raven n.

description:
I had sniffed the Mehfil at 2nd and Folsom and it smelled wonderful, so I was heading towards there for dinner and found this place on the way. Same place, they said. OK, I'm lazy enough to not walk 2.5 more blocks, I'll bite.

I ordered malai gosht (lamb), the kachri murag (chicken), the zafrani lassi (20 kinds of dried fruit and saffron) and the amritsari naan. My world got ROCKED.

A few years ago, a friend took me to a place in Riverside that offered malai sauce and it was the best Indian dish I had ever eaten, of the many wonderful Indian dishes I've eaten. I haven't been able to find it since and I had forgotten it. When the malai gosht showed up, I finally remembered. It is a cashew, cream, cardamom, cumin, coriander and tomato sauce. It is AMAZING. 

The kachri murag, with a spicy sauce, was also very good and my husband preferred it when he got to eat the leftovers (more malai for me).

The amritsari naan has a variety of seeds: fennel, sesame, onion and poppy. It was DELICIOUS with the meal and DELICIOUS the next day with some duck rillette.

I'm not likely to order the zafrani lassi again. Not its problem, just not as world rocking as the malai and the amritsari naan.

Have been eating my way through the menu...the chicken korma is amazing. What a great place.
author: Vena V.

description: Had their PUNJABI GOAT CURRY!! 5/5.. LOVED IT!!! It was on their daily special today.. Sad to learn that it wont be available any day that one wishes to have it.. I think its just once a week special or so.. Also had their Chicken Tikka Masala..4.5/5 .. Loved it too!! I prefer food to be spicy so ordered the spicy version of both curries. Of all the Indian food I have tried in the past one year this is the one I liked best till now!! Will definitely be visiting this place again!!
author: Gvn G.

description:
The food here is pretty good but service is so slow and unfriendly that it makes it impossible to recommend. I have come here a few times for the sit-down meal, and you really need to arrive at 11:30 or earlier for a decent experience. If you come a little before noon you'll have to wait forever to order and then chase the waiter when he deserts your table. We even had to walk up to the service counter to pay because we could not catch anyone's eye to request the tab. 

As an alternative, I recommend the cheap take-out meals. Besides not needing to wait for attention, you might get the one guy who smiles and greets you. I have learned to request extra sauce. Avoid the tikka chicken, which tends to be very dry. The chai (at $1.95) and naan are delicious!

I predict that if they can train their staff to be friendly (e.g., a smile and eye contact, attentiveness) it will improve their Yelp scores and chances of staying open. They should even have the staff in photos on their website smiling instead of looking vaguely displeased. The Indian restaurant in this location before them closed so if they want to avoid a similar fate they need to get a grip on customer service.
author: Anita B.

description:
I am vegetarian and when I order off their a la carte, their food is delicious. And when I ask for spicy food, it is actually spicy. Most places do not give me spice to my level when I ask, so I like this place for that. 

Their lunch menu sucks though for vegetarian people (for take-out or dine-in). I do not know who picks it, but they always have the worst choices. They pick fan favorites when it comes to meat - Chicken Tikka Masala. But when it comes to vegetarian, it's always some weird, not good curries. Once a week, it will be something good like Malai Kofta or Paneer or something. But the other times suck.

Their dine-in lunch special also includes lentil soup and salad, both of which are horrible. I don't know who would eat that. 

So I only come here when I have time to sit-down and spend $15ish on a curry and naan from their a la carte menu.
author: Saumya B.

description:
My dinner guest and I both experienced *digestive issues* the next day and this was the only meal we shared. There's not a ton of business at night (the dining room is really quiet on a weeknight) and most of the business is takeout.  That  being said, I was suspicious about how long the food sits out in the kitchen... frankly I don't think Tikka Masala gets freshly thrown together in the 15-20 min after you order... It's probably more that it gets heated up or something.  

Service was pretty bad the night we went. Unfortunately my waiter didn't seem to understand English very well so he couldn't understand my questions about the menu...

I think the Folsom location has better traffic in and out.  I've had takeout from the Folsom location plenty of times and have never experienced digestion problems.   

Lunch here is really quick. It's ready made so you pick from a limited offering and they scoop it into a box for you to go.  

They also open late.  They're one of the few locations around 2nd and Market that are open that late.  Your other options that I know of are Osha, Subway and McD that are opened past 9pm.
author: Alias A.

description:
$6 curry on rice to go (add $2 for a huge piece of naan).

Very Quick, excellent for a grab and go lunch.

For togo orders, go straight to the back and order then take it to the register at the front to pay.
author: Steven F.

description:
Extremely fast, extremely fresh $5 vegetarian food in the back of the restaurant to go.

Make sure to have cash.
author: Carver D.

description:
We regularly go here for lunch box in the noon ... this place is ok for a small quick meal ... hardly takes like 5-10 min for you to go in and out .. 

But the guys in the kitchen, behind the buffet counter are quite rude !!

Why can't they serve professionally with a straight face .. stupid people and the place stinks ... don't know how long the place will hold good though the food is fine ..
author: Deepak A.

description:
Based on the price/location of the lunch spot/specials I was hesitant and played it safe with the chicken tikka masala. It was solid, other people complain that it is dry, but my chicken was pretty tasty, not too dry. Cut up in chunks that are slightly too big and impossible to cut with that tiny fork, but when you work downtown do the right thing and keep some durable utensils in your office, or sit down and eat there. 

Super cheap, $10 for a large portion of chicken tikka masala, over Basmati rice, add garlic naan. Enough food for lunch and dinner. 

The naan was pretty middle of the road. 

In and out in 10mins at 12:30pm on a Wednesday? I'll take it, and be back.
author: Kortni S.

description: Mehfil is back! Let me explain. When they moved up the street from their Folsom location, we noticed the food quality take a hit. This was our go to Indian delivery place but we decided to take a break after some disappointing experiences with food. Happy to say after that break we gave Mehfil another try and the food was good again. Our standbys chicken korma and butter chicken were delicious. The saag dishes are also tasty.  Prices aren't cheap but not unreasonable. Delivery service is generally prompt.
author: Michael E.

description:
Food was great,  I asked for super spicy and they made a strong attempt.

DO NOT GO HERE with more than 3 PEOPLE and expect to split a check.

very frustrating and confusing, as if no one had ever asked this before.

Doesn't look like they have the ability to do such a complicated procedure.  

Food is great!!  just don't go with friends!  
if you only have 2 friends this place is perfect for you!
author: Al C.

description: The food at Mehfil has become drastically worse. Their chicken tikka masala was sooo dry & tasteless that I had to throw it out!! The naan was soggy & half-baked...how can you mess up naan??!!  Won't eat there again...
author: Maryam Z.

description:
So not been here for the first time but definitely this will be the last time.
We ordered lunch menus which was placed as ALA Carte first. Then when it was taking a while we asked the waitress to look into it and she corrected it. Well food came after sometime, when it came it came without the salad and soup which comes with lunch menu. We asked them again, they apologized and then came back with the soup and salad. Did not end here, they forgot another rice which they were supposed to give. Reminded them, then it came back. Now here is where it goes all downhill. We asked to make the dishes SPICY. It was bland as hell. We called them, asked them to make it SPICY as requested. The person went back, got a bowl of red chilly powder, placed it on the table and left. We were shocked. Any how, we called them again that we asked to make it spicy not just hand over some red chilly powder to be sprinkled to the dish. They apologized again and went back. This time the gravy came back and guess what, instead of trying to make it a spicy gravy, they just sprinkled the red chilly powder and stirred it and got it back, even without re heating so that it mixes well.

That was the time we were regretting our decision of coming there. But hold on- when the check came, it came with 18% gratuity for the out standing bad services they provided. We called them and asked and they said its a rule to add 18% gratuity for 4+ guests. We said but we don't want to pay that since your service was so bad. They said, cant do anything you have to pay. 
So what did we do? We paid left and here I am writing a review. For the 18% gratuity I hope it costs them more for what they did.
I wanted to see if there was no Start but unfortunately there is no such option here.
SO MEHFIL- first learn customer service from your Counterparts and then run ur show.

NO MEHFIL FOR ME OR MY FRIENDS AND AQUAINTANCES
author: Tanuka B.

description:
After skimming a few reviews to validate or refute my findings, I'm going it alone again and saying, "to hell with what others think, here's the opinion of Yours Truly." 
I stumbled (not so figuratively, maybe somewhat literally) upon this place after a raucous evening of drinks with coworkers nearby (if you're reading this closely you'll notice it is written on a Monday. Yes. I can't explain it).
Anyway I was not expecting much to say the least. I had never heard of it, a Subway was next door and I seriously considered it, but I've eaten at least a thousand Subway subs and after enough they get to be, well, just gross. 
So, enter Mehfil. I walked in, was promptly seated and after looking over their definitely expansive menu decided on my default Indian oder of Chicken Tikka Masala and naan. I opted for the butter naan instead of garlic naan because garlic naan and I don't always agree. Shortly after ordering I was presented with a nice dish of the masala, rice (which I didn't order but was provided all the same) and piping hot butter naan. 
Let me tell you, I've had a lot of curreis and chicken tikka masala in my day. I'm reluctant to claim "best" anywhere but this was damn good. Perfectly spiced. By that I mean it was spicy but not overly so. There were none of those annoying pieces of something that are always in masalas that are authentic. Sorry, I don't know what they're called, but I have to spit them out every time. They taste like licorice and baby diapers and they absolutely ruin every dish in other establishments. Not here. Here the masala is pure, free of all the annoying extras including bay leaves which they must use but filter out before serving, and lo - this is the real deal.
I surprise myself even now, writing this. I consider myself to be a fairly renowned snob when it comes to Indian. I've been to London and had some of the best, have been a Shalimar fan for 20 years, go to Amber India on a regular basis, and try as many of the new decent places like Kasa as I can. I won't way Mehfil is the best of them all but again I was not expecting much and was more than pleasantly surprised. I'll be back.
author: Matt H.

description:
I just had a pick up and was super sad as I  opened the bag ! The bengan bharta was reheated via microwave and almost 100% chick pea flour ! The lamb tasted awful infact tasted unhealthy and very old! The rice was ok! And all spilled in The bag because the lids had big holes ( 2 out of three items and the one item where the Lid was not broken was the rice ? 
And my stomach feels really weird now 
I had to throw it all away that's how awful it was broken plastic pieces from the lids  
with food yuck mixed in a paper bag  yumz :(((((((( and that all for 32 dollars ?
author: M. B.

description: Thought the food here was pretty darn good. I loved how the sweet lassi wasn't overly sweet. The CTM was solid. Love that stuff. For the price, great. Serve was friendly. Worry that they weren't busy.
author: Andrew K.

description: I would give them 3.5 stars if I could. The food is perfect for a quick lunch. In and out and the price is amazing, a full lunch for 5 or 6 bucks. The food is just ok though, nothing spectacular. Good not great. It will fill you up but the lack of spice and flavor may let you down.
author: Adrienne G.

description: Awesome Punjabi Food. Great place for authentic North Indian food. Chicken Tikka Masala is amazing....
author: Karan P.

description:
Had an order delivered to the lobby of my office on Beale. Paid with American Express. I do not know if they accept American Express for dine-in/pickup, but their online order system on their website accepts it. Delivery (ordered online) took about an hour, which is what I expected. I did not get a confirmation call after 20 minutes. . When I called, the order was being prepared and expected to deliver in 30-45 mins, which was accurate. 

The saag paneer (ordered it "hot") was excellent. The spice flavor was great, the heat was as-ordered, it had good texture, just the right amount of cheese, whole nine yards. The cucumber salad is pretty standard. I was not impressed with the chicken appetizer.
author: Jesten T.

description: I mainly go here for lunch, and it's hard to beat the $6 plate full of food. The pick-up counter at the back is where it's at.
author: Rob K.

description:
Price: 5 stars
Food: 3.5 stars
Service: 1.5 stars
Atmosphere: 4 stars

This review is about their to-go lunch only. It's extremely inexpensive for the location, $5-$6 (tax included) for a bowl of bismati rice and a dish on top (chicken tikka masala, etc.). The portions are not large, but you wouldn't expect them to be that big considering the price. It'll fill you up if you're looking for a quick lunch bite.

The food is above average - but served in a fast-food like manner, so gets dinged a star for that. Not bad, but not exceptional either - you get what you pay for.

The service is a joke. They literally will not allow you to seat in the restaurant to eat, nor will they give you anything to go with your order (napkins, get on your own, expect only 1 fork, etc.). The funniest thing is when they ring you up, never expect a smile - my friends and I have made it a game almost to see if we can elicit some sort of happy look from the cashier.

The atmosphere is nice, but since you can't eat inside for the lunch special, it really doesn't matter.

Seated lunch, which I've done before, is not that good of a deal, but there's no other classy Indian places nearby.

3 stars for being A-OK for lunch specials.
author: D K.

description:
many of my co-workers are of Indian decent and we often eat Indian food at lunch. One of my co-workers has been raving on and on about this place so I finally agreed to go. 

We walked from our office to the restaurant which is on the corner of 2nd and Market Street. I have to mention that this is a DIRTY part of the city b/c we found a nice steamy pile of yuck on the corner. 

We went inside and there were tables spread out on a lower level and more seating up the stairs. We sat on the upper level towards the middle of the establishment. 

The tables were small, marble garden tables.. we sat at one not wanting to take one of the wall tables that were for a party of 6. Which we regretted after we got our food.

The menu only had 4 items on it but the waitress told me they had tandoori chicken if i wanted (it wasn't on the menu). I ordered the Tandoori Chicken, someone ordered the curry chicken, my mgr ordered Paneer curry, and the guy that suggested the place ordered Lamb curry. Everything was served with naan and rice. My tandoori chicken was delish... i haven't had a place mess up tandoori chicken yet. All of the food was actually really good! For drinks we ordered different types of lassi: mango, salt, and a spice one. The consistency was off for the spice one.. there were big chunks of ice in it.. not blended well. The mango lassi was just ok.. the consistency wasn't as thick as i've had it else where, but it tasted ok. I didn't try the salt lassi.

I must say I am disappointed with their service. Our main dishes came out prompt but the naan and rice took forever to come out, we even had to ask for it. The table was so small that they couldn't give us all our rice and naan at the same time and we had to share which was fine except we had to keep asking for more when we ran out and it took long for them to give it to us. 

After we were done, they gave us the check but never came back to check our payment.. I had to stand up and give our check to the lady. (the place wasn't even that busy). 

I'd order togo from this place just because the food was good, but i will probably never eat in again.
author: J-nine I.

description: This is my go-to spot for delivery. It's consistent food quality and almost always right on time. The only issue is that the older white gentlemen who delivers from time to time has been very rude to me multiple times, actually yelling at me. He's had some trouble with our phone system at the building, and I guess has decided he doesn't like me. Always relieved when he doesn't show up with our food.
author: Heather M.

description:
This review is based on take out only.

This place is great because of the $5 takeout lunches. The reason it is not 5 stars is because the takeout menu changes daily so there are things on the menu that i was not interested in trying.

If you're a big eater like me, you will either feel slightly satisfied or full. It just depends on what you ordered that day. Nonetheless, it's a $5 well spent for a lunch (given you've checked out the menu online prior to going).
author: David T.

description: Good portions but underwhelming flavors -- even the chai was very ... mellow. Good service, good lunch-break option, fills your belly and may satisfy your Chicken Tikka Masala craving but not to the fullest, flavorful extent!
author: Shin S.

description:
They have lunch special here that is both good in taste and amazing in value.  You get a take-out box of rice and meatballs for only $6.  There are other lunch special dishes for only $5 from the take-out menu.

They even let you do a half-half mix.  (You do pay the higher price, so typically $6)

This is a new location but I am excited to come back again.
author: Steven M.

description: The worst indian food i had in SF. I had ordered mehfil e khas curry with kadhai chicken. The rice was not at all basmati and the curries were pathetic to taste. Save your money and pick some other restaurant..
author: Manini T.

description:
I have been coming to Mehfil restaurants for some years now and lately been coming to this one as it is the newest. My wife and I always come here when we are in beautiful San Francisco  and get our usual butter chicken and garlic naan and wow it is very very tasty that I always overeat here. 
 Service had always been friendly as I myself am very sociable and so were they in return and I love that. I will at times ask the usual waiter of other meat dishes he thinks is good, as I keep ordering the same thing, and the fish curry he suggested to me was absolutely great! I will sample my wife's vegetable dishes and wow that too was delicious. I am very impressed by the food here. 
  I have been to many Indian restaurants up and down California and I have to say this one is in my top 3.
author: Preet J.

description:
Great for a quick lunch.  $6 chicken tikka masala is my favorite.  They use white meat that is tandori roasted.  Makes a big difference!

Also, if you're there for a sit down lunch, their lentil soup is delicious.
author: John D.

description: I am north Indian, I've had north indian food in 12 countries so far, and in countless restaurants. this is by far, the most flavorless, spiceless indian food i've ever had. the pakoras were nice. the rest of the food - i could not even get through the meal - I had to pause and write this review. I am not going to finish my meal. (i had ordered a delivery through grubhub, if that makes a difference)
author: Vaibhav B.

description: Very long wait time, unorganized staff who were running around, rude. All on a slow Monday night. Not worth it.
author: Sara W.

description: They had some good lunch food and served us very fast. Going to the back and getting the special there is a great option for fast lunch in a neighborhood with ever-growing lunch lines, as long as you make sure to bring cash. I had chicken tikka masala and a mango lassi and both were pretty tasty, if not superlative. I've also had a sit down meal here a few times, with the same experience - not mindblowing, but tasty food and fast service. I'll definitely be going there again.
author: Xanda S.

description: Worst experience ever! Very bad customer service and on the top of it these guys don't have an order for waiting. They made us wait for 30mins and served us the food after an hour and when we asked for it the female server ended up with an argument which is totally invalid. Would never go for this place or recommend anyone in future for the service I have received.
author: Rohith H.

description: Wife and I went there and got some Chicken Tikka Marsala to go for each of us with Naan bread. This was our very first experience of this place so we were excited as we love tikka Marsala and Naan bread. So we take our food home and eat and the tikka Marsala was ok, not great  but ok. Honestly it was kinda watery. The one thing that made us decide to never eat here again was the fact that we found a beetle cooked into the Naan bread which instantly made both of us lose our appetites. This was so gross and we will never eat here again.
author: John B.

description: Good place, always order for delivery, but they always forget utensils! How're we suppose to eat without them?! Also, do not order rice with any of the dishes, they always just bring one, even if you've ordered two or three.
author: Joey H.

description: meh....this place is just ok.  The only thing I ever get here is the chicken tikka masala from the take-out section in the back.  The service isn't that great but what brings me back here is the $6 lunch plate that's pretty filling, there's hardly ever a long wait and it's across the street from my building.  The tikka masala sauce is almost consistent but sometimes it's way too spicy.  For the chicken, I don't think it's cooked with the sauce but grilled and then added after the sauce has been cooked because sometimes the meat is a little tough and dry.  I don't like that they keep their nann wrapped in foil in a water cooler so the bread isn't crispy anymore and you don't even know when it was made.  I think it was better when the restaurant was called Bindi.....it was 50 cents cheaper and they didn't keep their nann in a water cooler.
author: Yien S.

description: Ordered take out and was delivered the grossest food I've ever had in my life!   Makes every other one star review I've ever given look like Chez Panisse.  The chicken in my chicken biryani was purple inside and filled with gummy inedible  joints.  I couldn't eat it and instead had to have a dinner of leftover dried apricots.  Avoid at all costs!!!!
author: Kelly M.

description: They used to have good food but now they are bad taste Also the people can't speak any English so I have trouble when I order also
author: Claude C.

description: I love going to Mehfil for Happy Hour (glass of red or white wine or beer - $4.50), but more specifically for their Butter Chicken ($16.00). It's so good! Prices are reasonable for San Francisco.
author: Seth H.

description: I am not really a fan when it comes to eating Indian food out, but I feel Mehfil is one Indian place I don't mind going again. Their Samosas are really good, it has a distinct stuffing unlike what you get at other restaurants. I had their vegetarian dishes, Paneer Malai and Mushroom Mutter both were really delicious and the Garlic Naan was good too. They also have a decent ambience and all their dishes are moderately priced. I highly recommend this place for a good fulfilling Indian meal. 5/5 for food and quality of service. I would like if they could maintain their toilets and washrooms a little better. Hence 4/5 overall.
author: Chinz C.

description:
The lunch specials are subpar at best.  If you want a $6-7 lunch in this area try Lee's Deli, Fountain Cafe, or Jimmy John's.

I got the Chicken Tikka Masala, their "most popular dish", and it was very underwhelming.  All their lunch specials are pre-made and kept warm buffet style (trays that are being kept at constant temperature.  My $6 lunch (cash only) consisted of a generous portion of "Superior Basmati Rice" (which was just plain white rice), curry, and 6 bite-size pieces of chicken.  The chicken was very dry, you could tell that it was being kept under a heat lamp all day.  The curry itself was actually quite delicious.

Again, for $6 in this area, I don't expect much, which is why I gave it 3 stars.  You can get a lot more bang for your buck if you check out the other places I listed.
author: Aalok P.

description: We asked for spicy paneer makhani and the only thing that the vegetable tasted of was chilly powder. Not good at all. Also they had added alot of synthetic color that even after washing twice my fingers look like cheeto fingers..
author: Mohini T.

description: The food is ok. The service is terrible. Nobody receives you to ask if you want to dine in or take out. Impolite service. Almost as if they think the customer is lucky to have arrived at their door.
author: Deepa G.

description:
I went twice first one was better experience . Veg Biriyani is good 
2nd visit I wasn't very satisfied
author: Pavan B.

description:
Love it here. Fast lunch specials, good for dinner, delivery service. I have consistently gotten takeout from Mehfil and never been disappointed. Love the service, too.

Chicken tikka masala, channa paneer, basmati rice and a mango lassi were my faves. The samosas are delicious, too!
author: Jenna B.

description: They do a great lunch deal if you head straight to the back. Rice with a choice of an curry which can vary by day. The particular day we went in, I got the rice with Gajar Matar and my BF opted to get his with Chicken Tikka Masala. Both were great, but I do wish that there was a choice that offered a blend of both veggies and meat (rather than one being strict vegetarian and the other being... well, carnivorous). I assume it's probably just because of the specific day we went in. Anyhow, the meal was good but definitely treat yourself to a chai because it's delicious.
author: Shauna S.

description:
Mehfil is an excellent choice for lunch!
If you want take-out, go straight to the back of the restaurant and they have fast service for essential/premade dishes, like Chicken Tikka Masala.  $6.99 for a BIG portion is a DEAL in this part of town.  If you want a little something green to go along with it, they have a cucumber and tomato salad that is fresh and easy.  Cash only.

Sit down dining is a perfectly lovely option, too.  I took a job candidate here for a lunch interview and it worked out well because we could hear each other, the menu was easy to navigate, service was good...

Food Quality: A: GOOD QUALITY, WHITE-MEAT CHICKEN - HOORAY!!
Service: B+ :making it easy for a good, fast, reasonably priced lunch
Atmosphere: B: Clean, updated atmosphere - not over the top.
Price: A for takeout!  B for sit down
author: JM H.

description: I came here for lunch hearing good reviews about it from my colleagues. Their lunch option is pretty cheap but I felt that the rice was a bit uncooked. The rajma was less spicy than expected. Otherwise it was all good. Paying with credit card ncreases your meal cost by 1 dollar so carry cash :)
author: Karishma R.

description:
Food was ok but nothing to write home about.
The service was so terrible I will never eat here again.
author: Stephanie D.

description: i dont know if its just today or if it's this bad everyday. The food here tastes pathetic.
author: Chakradhar R.

description: Man after the A's game we BART it over to Folsom to get a quick Indian cuisine craving fulfilled but oh CRAP! it's closed but there's hope a new paper sign saying they moved to 2nd Street. you mean to tell me we walked in a complete circle? Any how they moved and it seems like the food got better. I was a big fan of the Chicken Vindaloo and the Tikka Masala. The Na'an was awesome and we loved the Samosa's and the restaurant is a lot cleaner and they have their own bathroom now. no more sharing with another restaurant which is weird all itself. I highly recommend this I think it's better than Any of the Clay Oven Restaurants sparsed in different areas around the city
author: graham c.

description: I have been at Mehfil a couple of times now and on both occasions, their food wasn't good. (More specifically, I was there for late dinners (after 8 PM) on weekdays). Also, the service wasn't very good - the person who waited on us wasn't too eager to please us. The food felt like it was made in a hurry for an lavish mid-night meal. Cannot complain about the quantity of the meal though - that was fine.
author: Hari B.

description: Awesome chicken tikka masala lunch box with rice for just $6! I swear they have the best chicken tikka masala in the city. I won't go anywhere else. The butter chicken is also amazing. When we get delivery, it's always chicken tikka masala and butter chicken with a side of naan. The dishes come with rice. The best!
author: Liz H.

description: Not bad, a little expensive for lunch if you decide to sit. Most people just pick up food and go back to the office (I think). We had the salmon tandoori, which was so good. I had the chicken tikka masala which was also good. Maybe just 5 items on the menu during lunch, about $12-15 each. At least the rice and naan are free. 3.5 stars (comparing to my faves in the Tenderloin.. Shalimar, Chutney, Lahore, et al)
author: Vol T.

description: We had dinner at this pleasant & attractive restaurant last night. It's at 2301 Fillmore at Clay street, very convenient location, as it's one block from the Clay theatre. Although my companion is a fan of Indian cuisine, I can take it or leave it---but I make an exception for Mehfil. My prawn dish was excellent: I like spicy food, and this was perfect. Didn't drown out the flavor of the shellfish, but enhanced them with a savory little kick. The Indian food lover had lamb Roganjosh---it was really good (I had a taste!). He would have liked an IPA to accompany it, but unfortunately their beer selection doesn't stretch that far & he was less happy with what he ordered than I was with my glass of very acceptable red wine. All in all, a place we plan to return to, as there are many tempting things on the menu we'd like to try. Oh yes---the service was very good: attentive & discreet. Bravo Mehfil, and thank you!
author: Helen P.

description: I ordered chicken tikka masala, veggie samosa, plain naan, and raita online through grubhub for delivery. Food came 30 minutes faster than expected, was still warm, and was delicious. The chicken tikka masala was very good and also came with rice (most places charge extra). The samosa came with 3 different sauces, so next time I won't order the raita (which was only a couple of bucks but was a huge serving that I don't know what to do with now). I would order from them again.
author: P U.

description: This review is for their delivery only - I've never been in. Good food for good prices - the biryani was especially delicious, and the chicken tikka masala was a huge hit with my office. Generous portions, great naan, and they include rice with your order so you're never stuck with a quart of tikka masala sauce and not enough naan to soak it up. Haven't had anything from them I haven't liked yet, and they deliver on time. Definitely my neighborhood go-to place!
author: Teicho S.

description:
FULL DISCLOSURE: I work 1 block away. I'm here twice a week for take out lunch. 

Facts: 

1. I get the $6 chicken Tikka lunch special, which is a round black box full to the brim with golden curry on a bed of rice. 
2. You can mix and match, and be like "Hey, can I get chicken Tikka AND paneer bhaji?". They will oblige. 
3. I always ask for more gravy. The curry must flow. Make sure you look them in the eye and ask.
4. Bring cash. You'll be in and out in 300 seconds tops.
5. They're not the warmest in the hospitality business. Don't expect some cheerleader waitress thrilled to see your sedentary face. I never dine in. 
6. Feel free to chat in Punjabi or Hindi.
7. They have another location on 2nd & Folsom. 
8. Menu changes, but chicken Tikka reigns supreme. Also costs a buck more - all the other lunch boxes are $5
9. A good way to cheer up a coworker having a shitty day is to get them a Mehfil lunch box, and talk to them for 10 minutes. You'll both make everyone else jealous of the amazing time you're having with each other. This may lead to bro time later on or possibly marriage. Offspring not guaranteed.
author: Vineet S.

description:
I ordered for delivery. It took them more than 2 hours, and I had to call them twice!!
Their food is good, but 2 hours is unacceptable.
author: John L.

description: Terrible experience. Completely empty, we sat down and waited 15 minutes with no service. When I politely asked someone for help I got ridiculous response. This place is run by morons.
author: Ansel M.

description: Well, I eat here probably four days a week and am always happy.  Lunch is cash only but at $5 or $6 out the door the price can't be beat (that's without naan).  I usually get a half veggie half meat dish, generally the tikka masala.  Anyway, I love it, quick, good and cheap.
author: Michael B.

description:
There's a saying in the restaurant business: people go for the food and come back for the hospitality. One thing is certain: Mehfil is a MEH FAIL. I'll never return to any of their restaurants. I recommend that you never visit. 

This review is for my visit to Mehfil on Second St in San Francisco with a friend on 3 October 2012 from 12:20 noon until 1:40 PM. 

I enjoy Indian cuisine. Truly, I do. Today, I did not. My friend and I enjoyed two delicious dishes: a chicken curry and a lamb kebab. Their sauces were sinfully rich and seductively savory. Included with a la carte dine-in are a salad, lentil soup, rice and naan. The lentil soup was littered with pepper, which was fine for me, but would likely not be great for others. The cucumber and tomato salad felt like a wilted afterthought scooped from a batch that was prepped days prior. The rice wasn't memorable, but it was mandatory. 

The naan... Everyone loves naan. If you don't love naan, something is wrong with you. Naan is the deliciousness that epitomizes Indian cuisine. A well defined Indian staple, naan is more necessary than rice. 

I like eating my Indian dishes with naan more than rice. I'd tear pieces of naan and dip them in the sauce, or I'd wrap pieces of meat with naan. It was delicious. I'm pretty sure I'm not the only one who enjoys their Indian food with naan instead of rice. 

 I typically need more than one naan, so when I asked for a couple, I was surprised that there was a long delay in its delivery. The menu indicated that naan was included with a la carte dine-in service, so naan should be made available at the request of customers if they need more. 

When heavenly, buttery, savory, seductively dipped naan is treated as a dish that cannot be provided to the client after he requests it multiple times but it was delivered without haste and as if it wasn't deserved... when a waitress condescendingly demonizes visitors who enjoy naan more than life itself... it's impossible to enjoy Indian cuisine. 

I received the final check, and the bill indicated an extra charge for naan. I was confused because naan was included with a la cart dine-in service. I mentioned this to the waitress, and she made me feel like an idiot. She said the naan was limited per customer and not "unlimited". She said the printed menu indicated this, but it actually does not. The manager's attention was called, but he stood back and peered at our table with no apology for the misunderstanding. The extra naan charge was only a couple dollars, but the waitress and manager's handling of the situation oozed a condescending tone. They were unbelievably rude and suggested that I shouldn't return if I couldn't afford the extra naan charge. I couldn't believe how belittled I felt. I couldn't believe how stupid they both made me feel. 

Naan used to make me happy. Mehfil's stingy, selfish, and elitist staff has ruined my love for naan.
author: Travel Swagger R.

description: Great new location with the best lunch deals. Can't go wrong with the chicken curry.
author: Craig I.

description:
Maybe 4 1/2 stars. My first time at the restaurant, a midweek dinner. The host quickly seated me, took my order and my food was served promptly and pleasantly. Following everyone's recommendations I ordered the chicken tikka masala, which was tender and well but not over-spiced. The naan was freshly baked, hot and crispy. 
Good Indian food in a pleasant new restaurant at a fair price. And they do take credit cards at dinner. I won't be sad to go here and skip a trip to the TL.
author: Marilyn S.

description: Great service!  Great Hefe Wiess yes German beer. The tandoori prawns were fabulous.  $12.95... are u kidding?
author: Jeff C.

description: Great daily lunch menu at excellent prices!  I love the Chicken Tikka Masala.
author: John D.

description: For $5, the only expectation I have is that the food is filling.  BUT at Mehfil, their $5 to go lunches aren't just filling, but satisfying and tasty!  With their different menu everyday, I'm excited to see what's for lunch!  This place is great!
author: Joseph C.

description: I was dying for some killer Indian food, and even tried venturing to the Tenderloin by myself at night to get my fix. Seriously Mehfil did not disappoint, although the service was a bit slow. But seriously!!! So good - the Murag Sagwala to die for!
author: Simonne K.

description: Cheap and fast, but the food was flavorless, and I received the only naan I have ever not liked. Will not be back.
author: Kristine K.

description:
The go to spot

Please note that I've only tried the lunch specials at this restaurant, so my review is based on that menu. Needless to say, everything that they offer for lunch is amazing, so I can only imagine how their regular menu is. The Tikka Masala is always on point and the chicken wrap is WOW! I have to say, I can probably eat that chicken wrap everyday of the week and not get tired of it. The prices for lunch are CHEAP considering the area at $5 for the regular plates and $6 for the Tikka. The wrap will run you about $6.50, but it is well worth it (I mean com'on! it's less that $10 in the Financial!!). If you come at 12pm then be prepared to wait in line and bring cash because the lunch specials are cash only. The location is awesome, right on Second and Market and the staff is generally friendly. Don't really understand what they are saying half the time, but I guess that's a good thing as they must know what they're doing. 

It is a bit of a walk from where I work, but I never regret it after I inhale my chicken wrap in about 3.2 minutes like a pelican.
author: Javier G.

description: great food and an excellent price! not the best decor.
author: Beth W.

description:
I had the rhum sauce lamb which was really good. I didn't taste too spicy (maybe I got used to spicy food?). It's also very affordable and the dishes come in large quantities.

Service is nice, it's a very good place overall. Peaceful though so don't go looking for hot ambience there.
author: Maximilien B.

description: We eat here at last 2 times a week as they are near the office. We love the staff and the food is great and reasonably priced. Once the owner even let me walk out for free and pay later because he only takes cash for carry out. Of course I paid the next time I came in but who does this today. Great place.
author: Paul W.

description: I love the $5 lunch special! Its rare that you find lunch in the fidi for $5 bucks! The portions are huge and the price is right! I just finished a huge bowel of sag paneer and rice for lunch and it was only $5 bucks out the door. From what i hear they have a different lunch special each day of the week. I will definitely be back!
author: V I P.

description: This location just opened up and it is right down the street from my work. It doesn't get an better than a $5 lunch box of spicy goodness. The staff is pretty friendly. Saag Paneer is yummy and veggie curry is good. If you like your Indian super spicy like me you might have to ask for extra sauces.
author: Kelly C.

description: Satisfying.  Some different flavors that aren't so common on lunch-time Indian menus.
author: Mike L.

description: Food was 3 to 3.5 stars, but I rounded up to 4 because of the good beer selection. I got the saag paneer and it was decent. The paneer was standard the usual restaurant quality (i.e. not very fresh or particularly flavorful). The saag was good. I was pleasantly surprised that it came a little spicy without even ordering it spicy. It was a bit creamier than the saag I'm used to, but it was good. Also, $10 for a dinner? Not too bad!
author: c h.

description:
They definitely have one of the best Chicken Tikka Masala and at $6 this is a great deal for take out! In the beginning, I felt the portions were quite generous, however off late, it does look like they are much more controlled in their serving. The food still tastes great!

Their other dishes on take out menu are so-so IMHO.
author: Ravish K.

description: Centrally located, clean and delicious. The service is a little slow so I've knocked off a star. The food does not disappoint, though! Their mango chutney is delicious. I also think they have the best Chicken Tikka Masala in San Francisco. I am also a huge fan of their samosas and garlic naan. They also offer delivery on Eat 24 so if you want some delicious indian food brought to your door, don't hesitate to order Mehfil!
author: Shali N.

description: So after I posted the first review the restaurant called me and explained that there was a mistake with the online portal and they weren't even open when my order went through. They apologised and I reordered today for dinner for about 10 people. They were quick and efficient. (He told us it would take 45-60 minutes and it was delivered in 30). The food was excellent quality and hot. Will definitely be back for more. Appreciate them owning up and solving my problem. Kudos to this restaurant.
author: Rushi S.

description: For $5-$5.50, you get a bowl full of indian goodness. The veggie lunch special selection I got a few days ago was great.  Takeout orders from regular/full menu are just as delicious!
author: Tiffany L.

description: I love this place!!! The food is amazing, the service is great and the staff are wonderful!! Plus they have red pakora sauce!!
author: Kelly N.

description: GREAT lunch spot. Its quick and cheap ($5 lunch special)  Indian curries over rice. The curry is not watered down and they are generous with the meat. Only down side is that it is cash only. The portion size is good. It definitely filled me up and gave me food coma after so I would imagine it to be pretty satisfying for a guy too. Check it out! The menu is updated daily I am definitely going back!
author: Tammy T.

description: This place has great flavor and good quality. Excellent value with the lunch box. The chicken is always good. The naan is a bit dull and thick, not light and fluffy. They also have a great rotating menu with different dishes regularly.
author: Johnny B.

description:
The food here is passable but not that good, but the food is not the subject this review about Mehfil. I live close by and for convenience I have ordered here a number of times (more than 10). After ordering a number of times I started to notice that the $ total for my order seemed to vary wildly even though I was often ordering the same things. I found this strange and started to pay close attention. To my surprise I noticed that they were frequently charging me for more expensive dishes than I had actually ordered.

The first time I noticed this I confronted the cashier who told me the charge was correct, when I picked up the menu to show him his error he looked like a kid caught stealing a cookie and didn't really even try to pretend it was unintentional.

The next time I ordered from the mehfil I was working late and my girlfriend picked up the food. When I checked to see what she had paid I was furious to notice that they had overcharged her.

The last (ever) time I ordered here I was again working late and wanted to pick up on the way home. I ordered the following 2 menu items totaling $23 dollars and when I got there to pick up the bill they presented me was $37.

These are people are not honest and will look to take advantage of you any time they think you are not paying close attention. 

Look elsewhere.
author: J W.

description: i want to like this place. i do. the food is decent. i have had better and plenty of worse. the 2 star is because twice ive been here to get there tikki masalasa lunch. for 6 bucks. great price. but once i got 2 pieces of chicken and 3 the second time. but everyone in front of me gets loaded.  i dont bitch about it to them cause i dont want to be the only black guy in there complaining about chicken. i just dont thjnk the guy likes me so fu k em. ill go some where else.
author: Kenneth S.

description: Awesome tikka masala, my favourite place for that!
author: Pol M.

description: Good price for the to go option for lunch.  Food is nicely spiced.
author: Abigail J. M. M.

description: Best thing about the place is the yummy food!! The lunch specials give value for money as the portions are huge and tasty! In pricey SF where you sometimes pay 10$ for an entree, a 11$ meal complete with soup n salad is a blessing.  The staff are courteous and service is good. Overall I have no complaints about this place hence the 5 stars! way to go Mehfil! :)
author: Madura I.

description: I have tried almost every Indian/Pakistani restaurant in the city and I have no doubt in rating "Mehfil" as the best .  The amount which comes with each dishes are very good. I have tried almost every items in their menu and each of them are phenomenal. They offer a very traditional Indian dessert item RABRI which I didin' get anywhere else..Rates are very reasonable and service is also very good...I would highly recommend this restaurant to everyone who wants to try Indian/Pakistani cuisines..
author: Sunil K.

description: Today, when I ordered the fixed mixed vegetable combo for lunch, they brought me curried tofu (no vegetables).  After I was half way through my main course, I wondered why the lentil soup and salad had never arrived. When I inquired, the waitress said "we ran out"  They offered a sweet beverage as a substitute which I could not accept being a diabetic. After I finished my 2 item rather than 5 item lunch, they wanted to present me with the bill. I told the manager of my experience, but he should have known, because he was less than 8 feet away from my table. He agreed to comp me. I should have been informed from the beginning if they had run out of things. Seems the priority here is to turn the tables quickly and keep the register ringing.
author: blaine s.

description:
Truly Authentic Indian food!!! Samosas are the best available across whole SF area... this is what i feel after my dinner at Mehfil:

1. Ambiance: Peaceful. Not noisy at all. If you like relaxing environment while you dine, this is the place to be

2. Service: quick!!

3: Staff: cooperative. i changed my order in between and they happily changed the dishes without any extra charge

4. FOOD: Authentic and GREAT in taste. Main course is as good as you can have anywhere else and samosas and pakodas are the best. 

5. Value for Money: totally worth it!

6. Would like to come back? - Yes - Definitely!
author: Arpit J.

description:
4 stars for food - no stars for service, so that gives you 2 total. Janky heffas working here must all be related to the owner and feel untouchable. Wow! Went here for a business lunch and was given a lunch specials menu, and a regular lunch menu. I wanted matar paneer, which I've had here several times and its always been good. The waitress was like are you sure we offer that? B, you asking me? uh uh..rude.
