Then I tell her yes, I've had it many times before. Unless you took it off the menu, it should be there. No, sorry, we don't have that. OK!
So I order the Tandoori fish lunch special. They bring one tiny salad for 2 to share, and we both ordered lunch specials. There is no naan....apparently they think we should be cutting carbs and we didn't know it. I asked for some tamarind chutney on the side and after 20 minutes, had to go up and ask for it. Lots of dirty looks from the waitresses too. The food was good and I will most likely order to go again, but damn gina, get an attitude adjustment please.
author: Royal S.

description: Don't dine in. This place is only good value if you get the daily 'to go special'.
author: Chris C.

description: Given the diversity, variety and flavor of Indian food in San Francisco, I can only feel disappointed with the food at Mehfil. My colleagues and I came here for lunch a couple of days ago and ordered the lunch special - which consists of an entree, basmati rice, naan, cucumber salad and a small cup of lentil soup. They change their entree menu every day, which is pretty cool. But in order to do that, they only offer a limited number of choices (7-8 if I'm not mistaken). They've done a good job to make these dishes diverse - a chicken dish, a lamb dish, a fish dish, a prawn dish, a kabab etc etc...Nice for meat eaters, but sucks for vegetarians, since you get only 1-2 choices. Add to that misery, the food was pretty bland, lacks spice and salt. The only plus points for me were the ambiance, service and the freshly baked naan. If the vegetarian entrees were tastier, I would visit this place more often.
author: Srivatsan S.

description: I would never recommend this place to anybody. We went to this restaurant thinking they would have really good food turns out that they do not know what they are doing.we ordered a shish kebab and it was taking too long to prepare and we suggested to cancel the order so we could leave on time then they told us that they would give it to us complementary and it would be ready in the next couple minutes but they did not tell us that they would serve it to us raw and uncooked. When we got the order and we told them that it was uncooked they simply told us yes it is complimentary and that the cook made it in a rush. I think this is very unacceptable and also the fact for us paying $61 and being treated like this. If I could have I would've gave them negative stars and I will never recommend this place to anybody they do not serve you well and they do not treat you right for the price that you are paying.
author: Davindet S.

description: Service here is the worst I have ever experienced... ever, period. And it affects not just your mood and spoils the meal or occasion but affects your food as well. For example, I had to wait 5 minutes before I could get hold of a waiter/server to complain that the chicken pieces in my dish were uncooked and even after that he just said "oh, is it so," and disappeared for ever. I kept all the uncooked chicken pieces on the side in a plate to show them how much of it was raw but they did not care at all and still charged me the full price of the dish without even asking if I wanted a replacement or another dish. They just do not have time during the day to take care of the number of people that come in. And more importantly - they just don't care. In another instance they brought my wife's order a full 15 minute after they served the other two people at the same table. Think of her waiting and seeing others eat their food while she waits for her order (that was from their lunch menu so it did not need any preparation, they just had to get it from the counter). Having said all of this, I think a good value is to take out their lunch box whenever they have chicken tikka masala. That way you get to enjoy one dish that they are good at and not deal with their service.
author: Rasesh K.

description: This is honestly the best Indian restaurant I have ever been to! The place is always clean and the staff is always nice and always helpful. They have a great variety for vegetarians too! Their naan is always fresh and always soft! The eggplant in tomato sauce is THE BOMB! I'm not a big fan of tomatoes but that dish is just so good! It doesn't even feel like you're eating something in a tomato sauce! Also their mango lassi is the best! It has the perfect amount of sugar and is the perfect consistency! If you're looking for some good Indian food definitely GO HERE! You won't regret it
author: Reema L.

description: A decent curry house, reasonably priced. The decors not much to write home about but the foods pretty good. I normally order a take out and have a beer while I wait. If you're in town for business and fancy a good curry with no frills then this could be the place.
author: Mick C.

description: I have been this place many times, both dine-in and takeout. But I don't remember which dishes are better. For takeout, I usually go for veg curry rice box. You cannot go wrong with just 5 bucks.
author: Emmy P.

description: the naan was straight fire. however the service was slow and when i ordered the main man tried to stare me down. they sassy but have good food.
author: Hailey L.

description: I am writing this review in less than 5 min i got the food...I asked for Plates & Plastic / silverware.....i did not get any.....i ordered authentic indian food and I myself can not recognize if it's the food I ordered.....anyways this place sucks BIGGGGGGGGG TIME........F T S
author: Sree P.

description: Started out ok. Over time you realize how little this tastes like Indian food. They use a lot of cream and a lot of color.
author: Jack S.

description: Cheap and filling.  Indian options in the area are not great so I'm glad there is a place I can go to for a quick take out lunch.  Both meat and vegatarian dishes are good.  Just wish they had some options for naan for the take out lunch when I am tired of the rice.
author: Jason C.

description: We got off the bart from Oakland and wanted Indian. We walked right into this place and were immediately greeted with friendly faces. We placed a takeaway order of garlic naan, samosa, and chicken korma. It was all very delicious. We had a few blocks to walk and everything was packed up in such a detailed manner that nothing spilled or leaked. The korma had just the right amount of spice. And we had leftovers for another day. The portions were great and the price was appropriate.
author: Murray K.

description: We love this place when ever we come to San Francisco but today it was quite disappointing. They quoted time the food was going to be ready as 10minutes and took over 25minutes to get it done with out a single update as far as what was going on there was hardly anyone in the restaurant. I would understand if the store was really business but a dead day like this restaurant s should work on their customer service a littke better than what it was today plus there were so many peoplw working in the restaurant I dont really know why it took so long. Disappointing very disappointing
author: Farah I.

description: YUM!  Love this place.  I only come in for the Lunch Box.  Go in the doors and all the way back to the back counter where the cooks are.  $6 gets me a combo plate of two things (usually Chicken Tikka Masala and some vegi dish).  YUM.  Have tried almost everything they have to offer and have not once been disappointed.  FYI cash only for the lunch boxes so come with cash in hand.
author: Roberta W.

description:
After reading reviews for Mehfil, a friend and I met for dinner at the Fillmore location. Perhaps I should have paid more attention to the fact that most reviewers were raving about the economical lunch specials.
   Dinner at the Fillmore location was, in a word, awful.
   First up, service. Our waiter seemed horribly chagrined that we didn't order alcohol. And he took our order with a table-wiping rag in hand. He utilized that rag, or a broom, for the entire time we were there. Much sweeping, much wiping, the drink dismay, then got our order wrong.
   The food itself---veg samosas, shrimp with mango, mixed veg in ginger/garlic sauce, garlic naan---were all tasteless and heavy. But HOT! Is was as if cayenne were the only seasoning used. 
   Addendum: the garlic naan wasn't hot, just dry and tasteless.
   In decades of enjoying Indian food in many cities and countries, I think this may be the worst I've ever encountered. 
   Next time, we'll spring for the $$$ and enjoy the excellent food at lovely DOSA down Fillmore at Geary.
author: Sarah S.

description: Easy to order online. Delivery had no problems and order was perfect. Chicken tikka masala was spot on in the spice department. I ordered plain and garlic naan and the plain was really just too plain than normal IMO. Garlic was great.
author: Alyssa A.

description: The service at this location was completely awful.  We ordered a light evening meal, a couple kachumber salads, bread, and chai.  The waitstaff didn't come back after setting the plates in front of us.  It took a long time to get some butter for the bread, and then we had to flag someone down to get our bill (and that came quickly).  The staff act as if they don't care about their business; no one checking in on the customers, no one even looking at the customers.  A man who seemed to have a relationship (owner, manager?) with the establishment sat in the corner, occupied with his cell phone and dressed wayyyyy to casually (rubber flipflops, really?)  If they want to be taken as a serious contender in a city of wonderful food establishments, perhaps they ought to act as though they take their business seriously.
author: Frankie G.

description: We ordered delivery from here via Grubhub. The confirmation email we received said the food would be here within 1 hour.... It took 2. We called the restaurant twice and all they could say was that the driver had left... They couldn't find out where he was or give an estimate of how much longer it would be. The food itself was quite tasty so I'm giving it 2 stars and docking the other 3 for slow delivery and unhelpful service.
author: Andree S.

description: I've eaten Indian food all over the U.S.  I've eaten Indian food in London, Paris, and Singapore.  And this place serves just about the best Indian food I've ever had.   The location is fairly new and doesn't have a following yet, so it's easy to get into and the prices are very reasonable.  We have tried dishes from every section of the menu, and it's all been excellent.   The front section of the restaurant has a couple of TV's playing (with the sound off) which I could do without.  Otherwise, it's great.
author: Carl L.
